Ideal family day out lots to see and do kids loves the water park and the train ride to see all the animals

titulo: BEWARE HEALTH RISK! Girls loved it. Animals not as bad as other reviews make out...
conteudo:
1st immediate and important point. Largest slides in water park which adults allowed on has poor, inadequate and unsafe signage. It DOES NOT tell you to sit up. You are not advised to sit up. You are advised to lie down and keep arms folded on chest. Exactly what I did. Nearly ended with concussion, cracked skull, or worse... thankfully not (@ least not without MRI or CT Scan that I'm aware of yet). When I came out of slide at speed. Once I crashed to floor of pool and grazed back / shoulder area. 2nd time I landed head first on bottom of pool. Clearly in pain emerging from pool dazed... the lifeguard told me I should have sat up. THEN ASKED if I was ok.... which should have been his first question. No incident report. No first aid attention whatsoever. No checking injuries. Didn't care. Or even appear to care. Reckless. Negligent. Dangerous. Be warned!

Rest of visit was fine. Kids enjoyed. Animals ok. Shame they don't admit for water park only too, as they appear to possibly do for locals, as place was swarming with locals in water park but not zoo. Kids would have loved to have gone back just for that facility alone. Needless to say I wouldn't be going on death slide for adults water slide again and would certainly raise full and serious complaint with management about this incident... which we have on film, incidentally!

titulo: Best zoo experience but be careful of the extras
conteudo:
I have been to many good zoos, Dublin, London, Chester but the access to the animals at this zoo is second to none. Animals 2 mins from the entrance and you get so close to them especially the lions! The safari ride is as good as a real safari (I’ve done the Masai Mara) and as good as Disney’s animal Kingdom) However this parks marketing and attempt to make more money than the entrance fee is worse than Disney. €1 for the car park. What’s the point? The food and drink prices are just silly but you can leave and return as we did. A photographer was going round taking pictures of kids beside a dressed up giraffe. She almost had a fit when I took photos “I take the photographs” she said, despite not asking my permission. I’m
Sorry but they are my kids

It’s easy to find despite the lack of signs before you arrive at the entrance. Getting in is easy when you buy tickets online. I don’t recommend eating there even though the paella was tasty there were no health safeguards to keep the flies at bay. A slush drink was €3.80 - quite a lot for a cup of coloured ice. Though there are several picnic areas to sit I struggled to find seats throughout the zoo circuit to rest my arthritis. More benches please. There is shade but it was still pretty hot so some drinking fountains and maybe a mister here and there for people to cool down would be helpful. I saw very little evidence of the zoos participation in conservation? I imagine it’s popularity is mainly for the small water park attached to it.
Fun place for small children. Swimmingpool very nice. We loved it there. It's our second time there.

Absolutely well worth money. Mostly on flat so fine for walking about and small safari train takes you around park to see most animals. Animals are very alert and well cared for, well worth money we paid for bus and entrance fee from Round Town Travel, Benidorm

titulo: Great animals, shame about the water park and cleanliness
conteudo:
Lovely safari/zoo and wonderful tractor ride around some of the enclosures and the animals looked really well cared for. The enclosures were lovely and definitely better than some of the other zoos in the area. however the state of the pools, slides and disgusting changing areas let it down. When we went to get changed and use the toilets there was poo all over one toilet, toilet paper blocking another toilet and the floor to the women’s changing room was black. When I went back at the end of the afternoon it was still in the same state. The baby pool at the top and the splash pad were so dirty and worn down we didn’t use. The splash bit with the slides was lovely but water was extremely cold so we couldn’t stay too long. The slides at the back were great, however slightly worrying that they leaked!

Overall it was an average day trip but I would suggest going somewhere like terra natura in Murcia if you want a decent water park.

Buy your tickets online to save 4 euro per person and expedite access.
A nice park with good view of animals, better in the morning. Aqua park on site for an extra ) euro which is quite good. Easily a full day out. Take food with you to save on cost. Your are given a wrist band on entry which allows you to return to your car and collect lunch etc. No need to carry it around with you.

This was our second visit here. Our first in February with 2 grandchildren ( 5 and 7 years) and then this visit with 5 year old twins grandchildren . It was a hit both visits.
You can make the visit as short or long as you need. In February we took our own picnic, did the safari ride and then waked round all the animals and saw bird and sea lion shows in about 4.5 hours.
In May we did the same but could have used the water park as well if we had the time, sadly we had to get home.

The park is clean and well run and the animals do look in good condition. I really don’t like the idea of caging animals but the majority do look happy, relaxed and healthy.
We had great fun interacting with the orangutans through the glass window.
The only criticism I would have of the whole experience is the commentary of the sea lion show. This is in Spanish and English (I speak both) however it is so fast I couldn’t understand either!

All in all a good value for money experience.

We stumbled upon doing this as we were planning to do some paddle boarding but the sea was too choppy. We spent 5 hours here and could have spent longer. We found a €4 discount online so it cost us €37. You get a FREE train ride around part of the zoo, there are lots of animals and they they appear well looked after. Listened to some of the tours and watched the sea lion exhibition and found both very educational. All signs, tours and exhibitions are both in Spanish and English which was helpful. I can’t comment on food as bought our own picnic in with us which you are fine to do and there are plenty of places to sit and eat. A really wonderful find and I hope we come back one day!

A great visitor attraction, a good variety of animals to see, animals are well looking after, staff are knowledgeable & friendly.Definitely worth doing the train ride & visiting the Lemurs. I would definitely go back & recommend.

To start our day we got there around 1 as it's a small park and we have a 5 month old. Free parking which is always good, i already paid for the tickets online as they are alot cheaper we paid 37 euros for all of us to get in gate prices were 22.50 each children under 3 are free. they take your picture as you go in and its 6 euros for one picture which we did buy even though our child looked moody! We then looked around at the monkeys and tigers as we needed to feed the baby and ourselves we ate at there outside cafe and fed baby. Ok food what you expect at a zoo park I had pasta which was 7 euros and a bottle of water which was 1 euro 50 was nice we then looked at the big monkeys killing time till we could go on the safari ride which was at 3 (they give you a timetable of events at the gate) we did then notice some people throwing nuts at the monkeys which I found a bit odd as in zoos in England its alot stricter and your not meant to feed the animals apart from farm animals, so I did see them and think it was a bit rude.we carried on and saw the giraffes again a nice a English family were feeding the giraffes nuts... I then asked them they said they thought it was allowed. So I have marked them down only due to no signs saying these nuts are for the animals or told were allowed to feed them. We then headed to the safari we loved it bare in mind we have a 5 month old so our experience of things may differ. Then we went to see the lemurs now if u can go! This is an amazing experience its just a walk though but I think they must be so used to people they jumped across everyone as you can see my boyfriend held our baby and a lemur jumped across! They seemed very happy. There is also other shows but I'm against watching animals perform for money just personal I prefer not to. They have karting but ofcourse I didn't do this due to a little baby! For a small zoo they had alot of animals we ended up buying some nuts and going to feed the giraffes and we have come not in season so it was lovely for us as it wasnt busy atall so alot of the time we saw the animals just us! I cant comment on staff as I didn't have much interaction with them apart from the gate safari ride and the food cart. All in all we had a good day! For 37 euros all the animals we saw feeding giraffes and holding lemurs!!! Definitely would recommend I'm not sure what it's like in busy season and it was a sunny day today so this may have played a part I recommend looking at the weather if you can and picking a day you would prefer! They also have a water park but unfortunately it wasnt open probably to do with not in season! Hope this helps anyone planning on going there and costs!

A three generation visit grandparents grown up kids and two year old granddaughter. We booked direct and saved 4 Euro each. We thoroughly enjoyed the train ride and the shows. We took our own food as food is expensive in the park, there are plenty of places to eat your picnic. You can buy a bag of monkey nuts for 2 euros to feed the animals feeding the giraffes was amazing all in all a great day would recommend.

titulo: speant half a day at the zoo when the weather was pouring down.
conteudo: we were in spain for the weekend & the weather was awful, someone suggetsed the zoo & we went thinking that it wasnt going to be very good, but we were pleasantly suprised. highlight of the day the kids hand feeding the giraffe. that memory will stay with them.

We visited here with our son and Daughter-in-Law and had a great day. We visited in April 2019 and the change from our visit in 2005 was unbelievable. We vowed after our first visit that we would never step foot in the place again, but Rio Safari has undergone a total transformation. All the animals looked well and happy. The enclosures were clean and whilst it wasn't the largest of places, we wandered around a couple of times, watched the shows and just totally enjoyed our day. We booked direct with Rio Safari on-line and saved 4 euros per person on the entry cost.

titulo: Elche Zoo visit with all the family
conteudo:
We visited today with 2 pensioners and 2 children and there was plenty to see and do with a variety of different animal shows spread out through the day. The feeding time with the ring tailed lemurs was excellent. There is a small land train that takes you round inside the enclosure or you can walk round the outside. The animals looked well kept, healthy and in good condition. Unfortunately there were a couple of areas closed on our visit today, the kids splash park and a small kids playground but there was an option of karting which was good fun and camel and donkey rides. It's acceptably priced (£20 entry for adults and £15 for seniors / kids) although there were online discounts of €4 available so book in advance if possible.
Indoor play area and restaurants also very good although slightly overpriced for cold drinks! Well worth a visit from Alicante or Murcia area.
what an amazing experience! The fact we got to play with lemurs free of charge was just an amazing added bonus! I can’t recommend this more, best €25 you will ever ever spend!

When we visited it was quiet in the park.
Very reasonably priced on the door, merchandise and gift shop. Food was served fresh and hot in the restaurant.
Zoo tidy and animals seem very well kept. All the shows were informative and enjoyable. The safari ride was amazing to be able to be so close to the animals. Our favourite was by far the lemurs! We were one of two families in there and it was an amazing experience to be up that close. They were extremely funny and cheeky!
Would definitely recommend and visit again!

titulo: Day out in Alicanti Rio Safari
conteudo:
Wanted a little day out away from the beach and hussle of Benidorm.
A really great place to visit not only good day out for a couple but a great place for families.
The zoo os well kept and the animals look content. However i did see the Bengali Tiger get a shick whilst drink its water due to the water being too close to the water supply.
The staff were helpful and friendly worth a day visit.

Had a lovely afternoon here with the family. Age range from 4yrs to 59 yrs and we all equally enjoyed it. Couldn't believe how close you could get to the giraffes. The prices of food, drinks and the official photos when you are inside the park are reasonable too. Highly recommend it for all ages.

We went to this zoo last year. The other two zoos in Benidorm are closed this time of year. A small friendly zoo. Which is easy to get around for young kids and older folk. Great price to get in with the promotion.
2 for 1.The bird area could do with an upgrade. Good information on the animals in Spanish and English. New splash park being built and also has a go kart track. Nice to get pictures with animals for a reasonable fee. €7.

Rio safari is located on the road between Santa pola and Elche. The animals are well looked after and a lot of fun for the kids to see. There is also a very good sized swimming pool there, to cool off after seeing the park.
Very enjoyable day plenty of animals and interaction with them. enjoyed the Seal's would recommend for all the family.

I have visited about 3 times and loved each visit. One thing that sticks out was how you are able to feed Giraffes and yet in London Zoo you have to pay extra for that. If you do decide to go, make sure you go to all the shows!

we loved it here! visited on the 27th December, not busy at all so we could leisurely stroll around the park at our own pace! inexpensive and all the photo merchandise was affordable compared to other places we have visited. Frieny staff, well kept animals and lots to see / do! All the animal exhibitions were operating as normal, we thoroughly enjoyed the mi I safari ride! our favourite part was meeting the rather friendly giraffe and mischivious lemurs!
Nice place to spend for half a day. No comparison to a large zoo, but good enough to spend a few hours and at a reasonable price.

titulo: Good for visitors of all ages
conteudo: Good to get here early to enjoy all the displays. Look for the discount leaflets when you arrive at the airport.
Great place can’t wait to go again especially now they have the water park too..more fun for the grankids

This a great day out for the whole family. Take a ride on the land train through the animal enclosures then walk around the park.

On arrival you will be given a list of all the feeding times and show times

The restuarant near the entrance do great food at a reasonable price

We came here for a day out. I love this zoo, the animals have big enclosures although I would like to see all the birds in bigger cages and there are a lot of cracked glass enclosures which need to be fixed!!
The animals you can tell are well looked after, they seem very happy.
Lots of animals to see and isn’t swarmed with people.
Very impressed to see a water park there and go karting so never a dull moment.

Terrible place staff are so rude. 4e for a wheelchair user to sit and watch kids swim. Even tho the person in the chair was not swimming they still got charged. I found the staff very very rude and the food was disgusting. Burgers were red when we bit into them. There was a thunderstorm and the electric went off while food was been prepared. The place was flooded. And trying to push a wheelchair in a pools of water was disgusting. We couldn't leave as the bus was gone and not returning till 5. The place was filthy after the rain all the animals waste was pouring onto the walk ways. I would never return here even if it was free. As the staff and the food was outragous. Way to expensive for what we got.

Me and my wife went with our two kids, 11 and 4 year old. I have been to several zoos but no zoo has been that dirty before. The previous raining did not help whereas water on the non-concrete walk routes. We needed to wash all our shoes after this trip. It seemed like moat of the animals felt the same way as we, dirty. If my 4 year old had been to a zoo before I'd regret this visit but he was able to see all the important animals every zoo needs to have, lion, zebra, giraffe, tiger and many more.
More like a Circus than a safari park. The animals are used to entertain the public.l was not impressed.

Visited the park with an open mind and was pleasantly surprised. Being able to feed the lemurs and giraffes up close and personal was amazing especially when there was no extra cost for this. We also got to throw fruit to the orangutans and gibbons too again free. We enjoyed feeding other animals too whilst wandering in the grounds. The sea lion show was good as was the parrot show. All animals appeared well looked after and kept in fairly large enclosures. My daughters enjoyed swimming with the sea lions (extra cost of 90 euros). In all a great day out and the only reason I’ve given 4 stars was the on site food which was poor quality and expensive.

titulo: The Water Splash Park is perfect for young kids between 4-8 years
conteudo: The zoo experience was good and we can't recognise the reviews in here that claimed about bad conditions for the animals. They seemed to be in good conditions for a zoo. We liked the show with the sea lion and the show with parots very much. The Safari-train was more an average experience. It was impossible to understand the english part of the guides talk. We visited the Safari Elch Park with an almost 6 year old boy and even though the water Splash park is quite small, its just perfect for a kid on his age but it might be a bit boring for more grown up kids above 10 years I think.

Took the family again after a visit last year and once again we were not disappointed. Up close and personal with the animals was fab. Always buy some peanuts to feed the animals, especially the giraffes who are awesome.
New swimming area for the kids this year was great and I love the fact you can come and go all day as you please
A great day out and would recommend to anyone

We took our 3 boys (12,9 & 7) here on 21st August. It was very busy when we arrived at around 2pm so queues for big water slide were approx 20mins but the little splash area moved pretty quickly. Overall impression of water park was positive. Then went on to visit the zoo & were delighted to be able to feed the animals! We particularly enjoyed the emus, lemurs & giraffes. You can’t do that at twycross... again overall impression of animal welfare was positive. We did the safari train which was a good way to look around the whole zoo area but make sure you keep the bit of paper with your train time on and turn up at your allotted slot or you might not get on. Returned to the water park at around 6:30pm & it was much quieter. Staff were visible and helpful, food was q expensive eg hotdogs & crepes were around €4 so lots of people returned to their cars for picnics etc but you can come & go as you please with your wristband. My boys had a great day & so did we! Not bad value too especially if you show online pic to get €4 discount.

titulo: This is a rather good park
conteudo: We visited the park with two adults and two children, age 10 and 11. We enjoyed the visit, we took us good time to walk around to see all animals. It was interesting to join the feeding of the apes, orangutans and chimpanzees, especially the children loved to through in the fruit to them. It was also amazing for the children to pat the giraffes. The train was interesting and you could during about 15 minutes see all the park. We can recommend this park, especially for families with children.

titulo: A nice little place to wonder
conteudo: A pleasant visit and for younger children this is a great place. Both exotic animals and animals you can pet. It was a pleasure walking through the park. No crowds. The restaurant was very good and well priced. We did go into the Water Splash park but it was very crowded and it was difficult to even find a place to fit in the pool - but considering we came in August - no surprise there. I recommend it to families with younger children - they will have a great time!

We had a great day and our 6 year olds loved it. The shows are informative and only 20 mins long so the kids don't get bored. Different from a lot of animal parks, there are plenty of opportunities to get really close to the animals. The splash park is the icing on the cake, a great way to cool down after a lovely day. I only give it 4 stars purely because I don't really approve of zoos and keeping animals locked up, but this park has plenty of educational value for kids and adults, and the animals have space in keeping with their natural habitat.

Wow!!! Absolutely amazing experience swimming with sea lions. Staff were so friendly and explained about the animals. The animals looked very well cared for and were so excited to be interacting with us. It is expensive but well worth the money. Thank you for allowing us to do this.

So once I knew I was able to feed a giraffe, this place was always getting 5 stars!!
In all seriousness from driving into the car park this day was great, the guy on the car park definitely enjoyed his job and was very welcoming.
The entry price was great, about 60 euros for 2 adults, a disabled and an OAP. We were given a time for the safari jeep ride and purchased some monkey nuts at the gift shop. We only knew about the monkey nuts from reading reviews on here. Definitely buy some so you can feed the animals. I saved mine for the giraffes.
We ate at the restaurant near the entrance. Menu of the day was really good value and really tasty. Can't remember the price but you got a salad, drink, main and dessert and it was more than enough!
All of us enjoyed the whole day but especially feeding the animals. Here in the UK, you have to pay extra for that experience but it was included. The giraffes were so gentle and elegant. They're my favourite animal and this place made me encounter one of the best experiences I've had.

We enjoyed a good day out first of all at the safari with a picnic then headed to the splash park after the seal show my 7 year old and 2 year old really enjoyed themselves and I thought the entrance fee was reasonable for a whole day of fun
We went to the zoo and water park and had a lovely day out. We spent about 4 and a half hours there. It was the best day of our holiday and the children loved it! Would definately go again.

Me, my wife and child visited here in July after reading various reviews both positive and negative. Obviously we can only give our experience which was amazing.

The entrance fee was reasonable and we had a voucher to get free access to the splash park which in truth we wouldn't have minded paying for. We also payed to do the sealion experience which was only 35 Euros each for around an hour compared to Mundomars Dolphin experience which is/was 145 Euros for only 30 mins. The sealion experience was amazing and we got to do a variety of things with them including stroking the animals, we saw a total of 4. We received kisses from them, got them to jump through hoops and circle us following our hand and more. The instructors were very helpful with good English. They also had 1 sealion who didn't want to carry on so they stopped and explained that if the animals decide they aren't up to it then they don't force them, which we thought was very caring. They alternated the Sealions as the day was hot and did not want to overwork them. We even got a little spectacle of them training a new youngster after our experience.

The park itself was well run with nice friendly staff and animals that appeared comfortable and well looked after. They were very interactive and the experience of feeding the animals was nice. Some of them were even just roaming around the Zoo, posing no threat to anyone but being inquisitive and friendly and also wanting food. We did not see any animal that looked neither undernourished or over nourished contrary to some reviews we read. The giraffes, birds of paradise and billy goats were among the most memorable due to their cheeky characters. The white cockatoo was very entertaining and was whistling along mimicking us and making his own tunes up too as well as having a good old fuss.

The water park was a little overcrowded but it was the hottest day we'd experienced at 36 degrees. Everyone was polite however and the life guards were fair in letting everyone has their turn and managing the park safely.We did not eat in the cafe apart from a packet of crisps so cannot comment on the food unfortunately but it did look clean and prices were mid range.

Our travel included getting a bus from Alicante bus depot to San Palo then a taxi from there which all in all was about 32 Euros.

Overall and amazing all day experience with good staff and plenty to do.

Try it and enjoy. Definitely recommend the Sealion experience.

Only negative is the website says to call and book in advance however when ringing you get an automated voice giving opening times and then it cuts off. This is true for both the English and Spanish speaking phone lines.

The animals were in small enclosures and didn’t look to be kept well at all. The crocodiles had dirt and algae all over the very small puddles of water they were in.
The one seal we saw was in a pool around 6” x 6” shocking!?
The water park section was better and better looked after ham the animals.
Very expensive for what it was tbh.

I would totally not recommend it!! Very hot during the visit. My daughter ended up crying during the Curiozoo exhibition. Kids were aloud to touch the animals during the exhibit and she was denied, then we were offered to take the picture at the end of the show and we asked for permission to touch the bird, but the bird was too tired to be touched, but not to be taken the picture. Funny! Isn’t it? They just care about the money not the animals in that aspect!

Tried to book on line for a visit to Roche Safari park was unable to do so. No suggestion that website was down or anything, also each time of trying showed varying prices!!! It is suggested to book on line to obtain discounts but impossible to do so!!
Taking screen shots to ask about the discounts.... let's see how we get on?

We have had our 2 grandsons out this month & this will be our 4 th visit
The zoo was very clean and the animals were clean well fed and watered
The zoo changes the water in the crocodile & other water animals every other day which is great
The giraffes are a real delight they take monkey nuts from your hand this is all free
We have had to pay large fees to do this in Uk zoos
They have an extensive petting zoo with pigs horses donkeys goats etc who also can be fed monkey nuts
The oranatangs are simply beautiful
The new splash park is fantastic it kept our 2 3year olds busy all day till closing they loved it
You can take your own picnic & drinks
The new restaurants offer good food at good prices
Nothing was a rip off
Thanks Rio Safari see you very soon from the
Curtis Sanchez salmonte clan xxx

Took family here on a Sunday. Place was busy and a small queue at the entrance but no great wait. Under 3s get free entrance - adults 23 Euros. There is a train ride and various shows including sea lions and parrots. Also a great water park. Great for the kids with lots of different animals including lions and tigers! We were able to feed the lamas, giraffes and goats. Most of the animals were seeking shade in the midday sun so I would recommend going early morning or late afternoon when perhaps they will be more active. Well worth a visit if your holidaying and needing some kids attractions

Well what can I say, after reading some reviews we were feeling a little apprehensive about our family trip to Rio Safari Elche but the little one spotted the leaflet and was desperate to go. When we arrived we took a walk through to the kiosk to pay and we could see the water park which look spotlessly clean and well maintained. We then continue through into the park after payment and had a little wonder round, the enclosures were a as big as any other zoo enclosures and if I’m honest as much as I love going to zoo’s I am a little funny on enclosure sizes, I’ve seen zoo’s with smaller ones and the orangutan enclosures were huge. Yes there are parts of the zoo that are looking a little tired and in need of a lick of paint but it looks like they have continuous improvement work going on. The truck/train ride was great fun as they take you through some of the animal enclosures and as are the shows, my little one was in love with the sea lions of which to our surprise he stood next to to have a photo taken. I would highly recommend going there for a family day out, but take swimming stuff as the water park is great fun. Beware of where you have a picnic if you take one as there is designated areas as they encourage you to buy food from them. Great fun for younger children

Talk about value for money , if you download a picture from their website it gives you 4 Euro per person off the list price so 17.50 for kids and 22.50 for adults
We visit here regularly but now for 4 Euro a day you can use their brand new water park it’s not massive but excellent value and lovely and clean , we arrived at 11 and were still in the water park at 5 ,it wasn’t manic like most water parks in July as you have a whole zoo to look round aswell , you can also enter and leave as much as you want and bring your own food and drink
GREAT DAY OUT AND VALUE FOR MONEY

It is expensive. The animals are kept in small ill kept enclosures. The animals do not appear to be well cared for and some actually look ill. The swimming pool is not suitable for adult swimming. The food is of poor quality and expensive. In addition, you have to pay for lots of 'add-ons' e,g, camel ride, children's pony ride etc. It is not to be recommended and indeed shouldn't be supported.

After paying their pricey admission fees they ask for an extra €4 per person for splash park. (Beware you can’t get a refund on splash park if you decide not to use the pool at the end of the zoo, therefore I would recommend just purchasing it at the end of the zoo part).

The large fees don’t seem to used for the animals or their enclosures as their orangutan looks so unhappy and trapped on that little island day after day. Also the water levels seem pretty low for the hippo etc although I’m not a zoo keeper so maybe this is ok. The track around is dusty and dirty and the toilets are yuck.

The staff are a little unfriendly and lack good customer service as we had two OAPs with us and they wouldn’t let them in to the splash park to sit at the side with a coffee and watch the grand kids without paying and extra €8 even though they had paid into the zoo. It was clear that the OAPs had no interest in going onto the water slides, but they did not care, pay up or go away is basically what they were told.

Luckily the kids don’t notice these things and seem to enjoy the animals.

Fantastic trip feeding animals little train around and a fantastic small water park suitable for kids up to 12yrs old you can bring your own food/drink also plenty of animal shows to keep the kids interested and not overpriced overall definitely will be back as happy kids happy mum and dad

The family and I visited here on a Thursday. It wasn't too crowded which was nice as it meant you could stroll around and look at the animals without swarms of people around you. The animals shows were good and you all got a chance to have a photo taken at the end with the parakeets and sea lion, you could purchase the photos at the end of the day from the kiosk near the entrance/exit. Nuts were €2 a bag which is a bargain when you can feed quite a lot of the animals including the camels and giraffes who were all very friendly. I thought the park was very clean and the animals looked well fed and cared for. There's a water park here too which is a good way to cool off on a hot day, we however didn't use it. Would recommend.

titulo: A great way to spend a day
conteudo:
Came to Río Safari park with my mother, husband and 2 children and we all had a great time. The park isn't too big and the splash park is a very good addition. We could keep our swimming stuff in the car while we took a small walk in the zoo and we went on the train ride which was very nice. Then we picked up the bathing suits and dipped in the water. After my 7 yr old had enough there we kept on walking around the zoo - the giraffs, zebras and goat area which is very nice and the animals looked well kept.
A great value for your money and the time goes by really fast. Only 1€ for the parking and brilliant to get a wristband so you can enter and exit the park as you want. Highly recommend.

I came here some years ago and swore never to come back as most of the enclosures and animals were miserable. Still my wife and kids persuaded me to go again.

And I must admit, that this small zoo has improved somewhat when it comes to the welfare of the animals, which is very important som me. But there’s still a lot to do. Especially when it comes to animals that I believe has some kind of “self awareness“ - watching the male orangutan mad me sad. If this park could somehow convince me, that they use a certain (large) part of their pretty high entrance fees to ensuring the improvement of the animals I would give a better rating. Until then I’m afraid this is more about getting money from tourists than animal welfare. The small water park is a nice addition though.

Really enjoyed our day here. All the animals look well cared for and lots of babies around, so the animals must be happy. Really good value for money with what’s included. We were there when the Lemurs were being fed and you are allowed to go into the enclosure which is a really lovely experience. The sea lion show is very good also. Went on the train ride around the park which was also enjoyable. Will definitely go back next time our Granddaughter is out with us.

Nice park to visit for 1 h, if nothing to do. Great experience with animals around farm area.

We was slightly disappointed of splash area, as main area is still under construction. Not lots of animal to see and very, very poor restaurant. Food was just awful - cold, greasy and expensive. Also charged us for car park what was not mentioned in the website and looked slightly suspicious.

We’ve visited several times over the years and it’s great to see the improvements and investment in the park, particularly the animal enclosures. You get really close to some of them. Our highlight would have to be going into the lemur enclosure at feeding time, being able to have them hop onto your shoulders is amazing, lovely gentle animals, we totally recommend doing this. The meerkats were adorable, tigers fascinating, and the goats very entertaining and friendly! The restaurant served good fresh food, and the baguettes were made to order and delicious, much better than we’ve come across in similar type parks. There’s a new extension to the water park opening soon, kids will love this to cool down and have fun. Compared to other zoos, I thought that 18.50 euros each (adult) with the discount was good value for money. We spent about 5 hours there and thoroughly enjoyed our visit.
it was a good day out took a while to get to know how to find things,i liked the train ride round the enclosure.

We had a lovely day here. Firstly, the car park is close by, it costs just €1, and when you pay your entrance fee you get a wristband which allows you to exit and return as many times as you like, so we could leave our picnic and swimming stuff in the car. It was a hot, sunny day, but there are plenty of places in the shade when you've had too much sun. The exhibitions were good fun and interactive, especially the 'curiozoo'. Plenty of places for snacks too. This is not a huge park, and without taking in the exhibitions you could probably complete it in a couple of hours, but we went on the little train, which was fun, and the three exhibitions and were there for about 4.5 hours. You can finish off with a dip in the lovely pool with slide. We also had a close experience with the giraffes who love the nuts you can buy on site!! A really enjoyable day. Don't forget to pick up discount vouchers in your local tourist information or on line.

titulo: Great collection of cared for animals, and you can feed them!
conteudo: We spent 3 hours here and are so glad we did. Its very relaxed, a good selection of Animals that all seem well and happy. They have various high vantage points where, if you have purchased a bag of monkey nuts at the entrance, you can feed the Animals!! And they know the sound of the bags!! The Giraffes are soo gentle and insist on more ha ha! And the Horses, Mules, Goats etc are the same and let you know if you missed them!! Concessions are Euro17.50 as opposed to the 22.50 normal price. And Included in this you get the Train ride which is a 4 x 4 towing carriages around the park through the various enclosures.... sometimes getting stopped by Bison or other Animals. The shows are also very good. And on the way out, we came acroos a pool area where people had paid to swim with the Seals, which was amazing!

Visit here very often with my partner. It's the nicest one we have been to in the area, where all the animals seem to be in good condition and very well looked after. You can feed a number of the animals including the giraffes. The shows are very good fun although limited seating is available. Food on site is very expensive and basic but have many picnic spots and toilets around in different places. Nice play area at the main entrance for the kids to. Not very big so only takes a couple of hours to get around but well worth it.

titulo: Great fun for kids, a great day out.
conteudo: We spent about 5 hours there with our 2 and 3 year old toddlers and they had a lot of fun, price seems a little expensive at first (22.50 EUR adults and 17 EUR kids over 3) plus 1 EUR for parking but includes all 3 shows and the safari ride around the park in the afternoon. There is also a swimming pool and water jets that they spent a good 40mins playing with so if you manage to find the time to do all those it's quite reasonable.Food at the restaurant near the entrance was ok kids meal for 7.50 EUR includes main meal i.e chicken nuggets and chips plus pasta plus youghurt and drink. Park was nice and clean including the toilets. We had a great day out well done to the staff at Rio Safari Elche, not forgetting the car park attendant who is very friendly and welcoming.

Visited here with family and thought the place was fantastic. The price was good for all you see. Free parking and lovely staff. Theres lots of animals which you can up close and personal with and feed!! We ate in the restaurant and the food was reasonably priced and very tasty. All in all would highly recommend and would defo visit again!

We all enjoyed our visit, but a bit pricey for a relatively small zoo and some of the animals didn't look very happy, especially the primates. Some animals who would normally live in groups were either alone or had only one or two companions.
Admission for 3 adults was over €50 even with a discount, and despite covering the whole zoo thoroughly and allowing time for lots of photographs we were there for less than 2 hours. Most of the catering outlets were closed and we couldn't access either the sea lion exhibition or the bird show because all the places were already taken by school parties.
The parking area didn't seem to have any disabled spaces which could be a problem in high season, but the wheelchair user in our party managed to get around the zoo itself relatively easily despite a number of very steep slopes and lots of sand and gravel on the paths.

We've been to Rio Safari several times now and it has improved quite a lot over the years. It has gotten better and bigger. The parrot show has been renewed a couple of times, so even after a few visits it doesn't get boring. At certain times you get to feed the monkeys. Kids will love this place

titulo: Brilliant conservation park with close encounter animal experiences
conteudo:
We visit here every time we go to Spain, we hire a car so don’t know about public transport to and from the park however free to park (once we have paid 1 euro). Its 22.50 euros for an adult but there are discounts for children and seniors, you can also easily access discount vouchers on their facebook site and they have a stand at Alicante Airport. The vouchers give a 4 euro discount per person.

This is a conservation park, where animals are moved to and from this place, I think its important to remember this as we have seen some in temporary enclosures, yet the next time we visit they are in proper full enclosures. Plenty to see, but not too large, plenty of space for the animals, there are shows (birds of prey, parrots, sea lions), new lemur enclosure, there is also a farm animal side where you can again feed the animals and pet them. Train ride around the park is part of the entry fee. Soft play for children and plenty of choice for lunch, or you can bring a picnic.

Best part……. You can buy food from the park shops (monkey nuts) and feed them to most of the animals, it allows a close encounter. Some animals are not allowed them and these are clearly labelled (crocs, monkeys, etc). In England, an experience like this to feed the animals and go in with the lemurs can cost approx. £50 per person extra.

This is a very good park and excellent value for money.
Didn't expected that it will be soooo bad.The price quality ratio is very bad. The animals are in bad shape.

Not a great fan of zoos but this is much better than the usual. They have gone for quality over quantity so that the animals have space. Quite compact as well so you can easily walk around. Reasonably priced for families. Food ok and inexpensive. If in the area well worth a visit.

Not cheap to enter park. Friendly staff. They will call you a taxi to get home but it already has 10€ on the meter when you get in. Otherwise big free car park. Good selection of animals and impressive sea lion show. The restaurant gets very busy after this. Soft play for children is good. Food not at all bad. Don’t miss chimp feeding and sea lion show. Dusty paths. Wear old shoes.

I went to Rio Safari Park in Elche with my family and we loved it, the staff is first class and great service and atmosphere is great,I love it and recommend you don’t miss this before leaving Spain,great job Rio Safari. :)
It was really nice, since there was not crowded and weather was perfect. Safari train was nice and the zoo okay in total. We did also karting, wich was conviniently there aswell.
Both my husband and I really enjoyed visiting rio safari. Would recommend for couples and for families.

After much research without a car, we caught train from Alicante to Elche Parq and called Radio Taxis to get to Rio Safari- there is no direct train or bus and is 11km outside of town. Did end up costing more to travel there and back than entry fee.

Safari park itself was very quiet, some good exhibits, some so-so. Felt several animals were overcrowded in too small spaces but overall the animals looked well fed and ok. Train safari about 20 mins, 3 shows 15-25 mins (parrots, mixed small animals and sea lions) and you can pay to have photos taken after each show.
Overall enjoyed the day.

This zoo is an amazing day out. Entry is well priced but can be cheaper if you can pick up one of the discount leaflets in town.

The layout is very well laid out which allows excellent close up views of the animals. The safari ride is an opportunity to get extremely key close to the wild African animals.

The lemur enclosure allows them to climb all over you to get great photo opportunities.

One of the best Zoos I’ve ever been to
What a great day we had. We got to feed most of the animals just parrots and orangutang couldn't be fed.

Very impressed with everything about this facility. You can easily spend a day here. Admission is not overly expensive and lets you into the Safari facility for the day, including free access to animal shows and safari rides.

Obviously there is a lot of controversy about zoos and about wild animals being kept in cages- at Rio Safari, however, it feels like the animals welfare is consistently put first and their habitats are reflective of that. Additionally, the various shows- about the sea-lions, the birds, and the menagerie- are all informational: not about the animals doing tricks, but informing the public about the individual animals and what they can do. I was really surprised and impressed by this! There's also a chance to meet the animals at the end, and you can tell that all of the keepers are really passionate about the animals.

Also, at each of the shows and during the safari, the keepers will speak in both English and Spanish, suitable for a diverse audience!

The safari itself is well laid out and accessible for all, and there are snack outlets all around the safari, as well as a restaurant outside. On the grounds there is also a small waterpark (closed for the winter) and a racing track- this we did visit and the staff were super friendly, although it is slightly expensive- 15EU for 8 minutes.

Overall, I would definitely recommend a visit here- it would be easy to spend a day here, especially with younger children, and the safari park is clearly dedicated to the animals and their welfare, and this definitely comes through in the running of the park. Congrats to the staff of the park for such an amazing job at running the park!
Great place for any age and a great place to get up face to face with the animals - shows are good for the kids and adults alike with English translations
Second visit to this fabulous place. They are making it even better. The staff are friendly and helpful and shows are all good. Great place for young children and us adults! Will go again!

titulo: Kept us occupied for the day
conteudo:
Were a little unsure looking at the mixed reviews. Can't say we had any real complaints though to be honest.
Kids enjoyed feeding the animals, and the animals were enjoying being fed! They were all coming over, including the zebras and giraffes!
A shame the water slides close out of season, but the splash park was open and the kids loved it!
I don't think the animals are poorly looked after. Yes it's hot and dry but nothing compared to their natural habitats and they were all fed well and looked healthy, if not a bit warm in the midday sun.
One word of warning -WEAR BUG SPRAY- I was eaten alive!!

titulo: Good Zoo. Well worth a visit.
conteudo:
This place gets mixed reviews, but you can safely ignore the bad ones which seem to be from tree-hugging vegetarians and animal rights activists.

This is a value for money attraction. You can get up close and personal with species from all over the globe, Have fun and learn something at the same time.

For €22.50 you have access to the zoo with several shows (parrots, birds of prey, sealions etc) thrown in.

Animals all seem healthy and active. Enclosures vary in degrees of salubriousness but all are accessible and laid out fairly well.

Ok, some areas could be better and some are in the process of construction and renovation but still well worth a visit.

You can come and go all day on a ticket and there are several snack bars and picnic areas with a reasonably priced restaurante at the front door.

Enjoy this place. Where else can you feed peanuts to a giraffe in Alicante?

titulo: Perfect for the first time in a zoo
conteudo: For our son it was the first zoo ever. He totally exhausted with all the new experiences. I never could imagine he liked it soo much. There are nice animals, the zoo-trip shows you around. There are some roads which were perfect to sleep on daddy, not crowded, not sunny.

Three of us went to the safari park (but it's a zoo really) to celebrate a birthday. We had a great time. It's small enough to walk around and has all our favourites: big cats, monkeys, reptiles, rhino, giraffe and more. Free parking, friendly staff, events, a train and plenty of cafes, picnic areas and children's play areas. Unlike UK zoos you can get up close and feed/pet the safer animals. Our fav: feeding nuts to giraffes. Great family day out.

We have been in the area for 16 years and never been here before so thought we'd finally give it a try. We paid €18,50 per adult and booked online the night before. We had no email confirmation or anything, but the website just said bring your ID which we did. This caused a little issue when we arrived as the ticket office seemed to expect proof of purchase rather than ID, but we got in OK in the end. On arrival we also had to pay €1 to park all day. We were there for about 10:30 and were given an itinerary for the day. This included a parrot show, a bird of prey show, a sea lion show, a lemur experience and feeding the orangutans and chimps. So whilst we were going round the various animal enclosures we also had another activity every half hour or so. There was also a free train ride which actually went inside and through several of the animal enclosures so we got up even closer to the animals. The staff were all very enthusiastic about the safari and mostly spoke English too. We stayed about four hours by which time we had seen all the shows and all the animals. We did not eat there, but there were several options and also other activities for children, play areas, farm, pools etc. So had we gone with kids we would probably stayed much longer and made a full day of it. We have been to better safari parks in the UK, Spain and elsewhere, but this is certainly worth a visit if you are in the area.

Good place where spend time with children . Giraffes are fabulous!!! Take with you eucalyptus leaves for giraffes and enjoy feeding them.
Don't forgot take food for you also.

Was really fun and enjoyable. Loads of different animals staff were nice and friendly needs a cash boost to finish off attractions and upgrade the place for staff and animals. The place does come equiped with a swimming pool so bring your trunks too.

titulo: NOT GREAT-needs some TLC and staff need to be happy!
conteudo:
Came today with an open mind having read the mixed reviews ...
Would I recommend to to family/ friends...sadly I wouldn't ,the staff are not friendly ,seem a bit rough with the animals.crocodiles and hippos need more water in there pool.train tour lasted about 15mins tops and didn't go in the zebras or Giraffe enclosure but yet pictures on website show the train in there.The exhibition shows are terrible, don't speak much in English and when they did couldn't really understand them..
If you are thinking of coming I would say DON'T ...go to mundorma instead!

We came here thinking we would only spend a few hours but ended up spending all day here. When getting there you receive a wristband which allows you to go in and out if the park which you can leave bags etc in your car. There is even a swimming pool outside for children and families to use. There are also nuts you can purchase for 2Euros at various places to feed certain animals. Train ride and shows are included in the standard price.

titulo: A more animal friendly approach needed
conteudo:
I went to the Safari Park with an open mind , having read the reviews . I'm not one of those 'anti -circus' people but someone who has worked animals all by life .
On a positive note the shows - parrott , sea lion etc were brilliant , but the living conditions of the animals leaves a lot to be desired . You can judge how an animal feels by its general demeanour & the condition of its cost . What I saw yesterday wasn't good / inadequate shade, water , feed & living conditions .
This park needs a major upgrade and a more animal centred approach before I would return again with my grandchildren .

Can only comment on the sealion experience which was amazing. We prebooked the experience for two children. They had a wonderful half an hour experience. Plenty of interaction with the sealions. They were in a group of 12 people. Plenty of opportunities to take photos from the side. Photographer also there taking photographs. Experience cost €35 each plus photos 1 for €6, 2 for €16 then €5 each thereafter. You do not need to pay for entry to Rio Safari itself as the experience is just outside the main entrance. Lovely little picnic area and splash pool area while waiting for the photos. A wonderful experience.

We drove 50 mins from Campoamor to Elche and stopped off for a quick McDonalds in the town before heading to the park. At first sight / or smell we were not sure 🤔 there is a parking area and restaurant there's also a pool and small water park / slide area to cool off... we didn't but it would be suitable for smaller kiddies 👶.. we paid €62.50 for entry for the three of us. They charged kids price for our 14 year old!! There is a train / jeep with seated-trailers at various times but we decided to walk.. some parts to be honest were a bit depressing but there were some special animals the lions 🦁 and especially the giraffes. On entry buy the peanuts 🥜 you will have some fun moments with the giraffes and will get close up!!! That was a highlight and we laughed as we didn't know you could feed the giraffe or that that get close up and personal 👍👍👍👍

Great 3rd time we have been here first during summer months and the water park was open !!!
Lots too see and doo great day or food good priced aswell and drinks over all fantastic

titulo: Disgusting conditions - animals had no water.
conteudo: WOULD RATE 0 STARS. (From the U.K.) I am disgusted by this place. In the 31 degree heat, not one animal had a reasonable amount of water except for the tigers. Lions had none. First impression as I walked in was not good, small horses and camels were tied to the fence (obviously where they are kept when they are not being ridden) in a small enclosure, the horses forced to stand in the sun with no shade as they were restricted by the rope. These animals HAD NO WATER in the boiling heat. I spoke to two staff members telling them this, the first did not understand what I was telling them (that they had no water) and the other, who was holding a snake, did not seem bothered by said that she would tell someone in the office. Many animals were forced in enclosures that were clearly way too small, again with none or barely any water. But the worst experience of the day was seeing a day old newborn BABY GOAT, UNCONSCIOUS ON THE FLOOR. This poor goat was clearly suffering with the heat, with flies climbing inside its eyes, nose and mouth. I was disgusted and my family and I told a woman who was in the nearby shop and she had said that she had called someone about it. We waiting at least 30 MINUTES for someone to come to this baby goat for them to pick it up and say that it would be taken to the vet room. After it had gone, the mother of the baby was clearly distressed where her child had gone and sniffed the ground and was making horrible noises. My recommendation is to not go to this horrible place.

Been annually for 12 years. its become a family must on holiday. Improvements made constantly. Love feeding the giraffes and petting the goats. Dont miss the Safari Ride and all the shows. Food good and not expensive, but can take a picnic, tables available. Price includes all day use of outdoor pool which is very clean. Thoroughly recommend a visit.

titulo: Great for kids of all ages ...
conteudo: Excellent experience with my nearly 5 year old granddaughter. Especially the 'Safari Tour' , 'Farmyard' , picnic areas , and the water park out front. A great value day out for kids of all ages. I personally loved the 'Reptile Caves' ~ as often in Spain, poor signposting is a slight issue !

Brilliant day! Highly recommended! Make sure you bring swim clothes/nappies and plenty of suncream it was 34 degrees when we went. Food was lovely and not badly priced! There are plenty of shaded areas. Staff where lovely and helpful.

We visited the parj yesterday, as we did for the last two years. We spent a great day. New playing areas around the swiming pool are great. We took lunch at the same time the kids were playing there just in front of us, in a very shady and fresh area.
The bad things are that management need to take care of cleaning in the changing room, it was disgusting.
In the other side, I agree too much with some of the previous comments, the overal state of the park is getting worst every year, despite the never ending renovation works.
It is sad to see how the park look more abandoned every year.
Nevertheless, I will continue coming every summer hoping this situation improves.

We visited on a Friday, we got there as it opened and it was quite quiet and not too hot at this time. The staff are very friendly and helpful. If you take a leaflet or get a voucher online it reduces your price by €4 per person. The animals are well looked after and the zoo seems to be constantly improving it's enclosures. The train ride wasn't particularly good, and doesn't go around the parts on the map it says it does. Lots of photo opportunities are captured by staff and vary in price from €6.50 for a magnet and key ring to €8 for a picture with a sealion (which was a lovely experience)

The sealion show isn't great and the trainer doing it speaks so quickly in English and Spanish, we couldn't understand a word he said! But be sure to get their early if you want to see it as the best seats at the back are sheltered from the sun. The photo with the sealion takes place after the show and you'll need to pay before having it taken and collected an hour after it's been taken.

So if your family love a day out at the zoo and see some animals that maybe you don't get to see so often, it's well worth a visit. Animals are well looked after and happy. The chinpanzees are amazing and very entertaining. And don't forget your swimwear for the pool or if you want to swim with sea lions (€35 extra)

Overall the goods outweigh the bads! A good day out had by all the family!

titulo: Kids had fun. Park needs maintenance.
conteudo: I went here in June 2015 - and again in July 2017 and I had this feeling that since then, the overall standard decreased a bit. Many toilettes out of order. Dead/ badly maintained plants all over. But still, our kids loved the experience (2-6 years). Swimming pool is perfect addition to the Zoo for cooling down (no extra charge)

titulo: Lovely day out.. better than expected
conteudo: I visited the Rio Safari at the beginning of July and thoroughly enjoyed the day. I was slightly concerned about some of the animals who did not have enough space to properly exercise etc. However there were staff members attending to the majority of the animals and lots of babies. The options for food were limited which was to be expected but could do with some more choice. The swimming pool was a welcome addition after walking around in the heat for a few hours. Would visit again.

Animals are amazing very educational for children.
However alligators in enclosures no water, work being done to maintain enclosures animals don't look as though they are cared for. Correctly.
Animals look underfed.
Pool great to cool down but changing rooms we're discussing state.

This is one of the biggest examples of animal cruelty I've ever seen.
We made the mistake to come here, and I write this review that maybe some others wont.
Please, don't support this park by visiting it.
The animals have far too less space. No species-appropriate attitude at all.
The crocodiles not even have water!
The shows are cruel and far too loud. No shadow to sit in. Not suitable for kids.
We left after the first show. Thats why I can't say anything about the food...
Really nice track, with great fun also for first-timers in go-cart! Friendly hostes and Good guidance before take off.

Our trip to day at rio safari was disappointing all they are interested in doing is selling you photos at 7-8 euros each and one of the men's toilets both urinales covered over not working one of the other toilets flush button not working and then the taps move when you try and turn them on no sign of plumber the signs around the bird of prey show all torn or water damaged and the ropes around the same exhibit all on the last legs nice new picnic area with good seating but generally all the silly small jobs that need doing are being over looked witch makes the place look tired questionable whether it's worth 22euros a person won't be rushing back.

We took a day out at Rio Safari with two teenagers as a day away from beach or shopping. Rio Safari is a small size safari park between Elche and Santa Pola. They have a fair assortment of animals with varying backgrounds. The park may look tired but this is due to the intense heat during the summer months. Equally the animals are most active in the early morning or late afternoon.
A train ride through some of the enclosures provides a closer experience along with a number of shows providing some entertainment. For additional cost you can enjoy a swim with sealions which is very much worth the cost of 35 euros. The food outlets are fine without the normal extortionate costs that most UK outlets demand and there is a pool during the summer for some much needed relief from the summer sun.
The park is interesting and enjoyable for all ages but visitors should not expect the well polished facilities and presentation of other European partners. Overall a good trip for those spending time in the local area

Most of the shops were closed , very few people and some animals were missing. Morever it seems like they are not kept in very good conditions. Mundo mar in benidorm is better. Dont waste your time here

titulo: Worth a visit - more than a Mini-Zoo
conteudo:
I visited Rio Safari with my 9 year old son while my wife and daughter did Corte del Inglés and more shopping in Alicante.
I had pre-booked a sea lion swim session by phone (easy) and booked tickets online (easy and with discount).
We paid €31,50 for entry, €70 for 2 x sea lion swim, €30 for swim-pictures, €8 for 8 minutes carting (my sons succesfully debut) and €12 for lunch. And it was worth it :-)
You need the admission to enjoy the park, the waterpark-area and the safari train ride.
You should absolutely spend €35 for a half hour in the pool with the sea lions. A great and rare experience. Save somewhere else and give yourself this: 10 people, 2 skilled trainers, 2 friendly sea lions and 30 minutes in a pool with wet kisses, tricks and touching an unique animal.
The carting was a nice surprise and my son loved it!
We arrived at 11 pm, parked closely to the entrance and didn't experience queing or crowds.
If you do a safari park in Spain during high season this is in the higher range. It's not spotless or in mint condition everywhere, and they do want you to buy photos, but that's no surprise. However they are comitted, service minded, english speaking (or eagerly trying) and the animal have good conditions.
But again - the fifth point we give because of the sea lion swim experience.

The zoo part was worked down and many cages were empty. Some of the cafeterias were closed in the middle of the day.
The big swimming pool wasn't suitable for 5 year olds and it was only the women's locker room that had lockable clothes storage. Go kart area was worned down.
Food existed but not exactly a great experience.

titulo: Especially fun for the train and the swimming pool
conteudo:
Small zoo compared to the ones we have in Belgium, but still a lot of different animals to be seen.

I would really recommend the train that goes through the exhibits of some animals (which is included in the price of the entrance ticket). We also enjoyed the combination with the swimming pool, especially because the zoo isn't big enough to spend a whole day watching the animals. The shows with the animals were nothing spectacular.

In whole, it is a fun trip to do with smaller children, but I think somewhat older children will not find their amusment here.

titulo: Nice little safari, the shows are very good
conteudo: Went on a hot day, there is not much of a shade there, although it has a lot of palm trees, so prepare for that. The roads are rock, so we would recommend either socks or closed shoes. We saw the sea lion show and the parrot show and went on the train ride. All of those were fantastic. The food in the cafeteria is pretty simple, so we recommend some extra food and drinks. If you buy some food there the kids get a free entrance to a soft play castle though, which our 4 year old found pretty fun.

Went off season so the pool and slide were not available which was a bit of shame as it was so hot. I do admit that most of the animals were inside or hidden under shade so hard to see as it was so hot. Don't blame them! Other than that it was a good trip out and the kids seemed to like it. Loved the orangutans and the sea lion show.

There are enough reviews of the zoo itself so I'll focus on swimming with the Sea Lions. Amazing to say the least. I went in with my two children. 8 and 11. Importantly they are both above 135cms which is enough to keep your head above the water. Firstly the staff were amazing and really patient with the children. It was full immersion with the animals. You could stroke, dance and do tricks with them and the Sea Lions loved it! You get a good 30 mins as well. There were 9 in our group which was plenty. It's a must for the area and the money goes to charity and the animal upkeep.
My children will remember it for ever! 👍

A great day out with the kids! We choose to drive from our Vila and found it extremely easy to find thanks to TOMTOM.

Parking - thought this was a chance for the company to rip us of but we were extremely surprised to find it was €1 ALL DAY! Brilliant !!

Entrance - we prepaid before arriving and saved around 4 euro per ticket , which was a bonus!

Park- the park itself was great, a real authentic feel ! Felt animals were happy and looked after , staff were amazing !! Constantly smiling and welcoming !! Those little things make a difference!

Shows- the shows were great, I would recommend the 'zoom in ' show as the trainers themselves made the show !! They handled the animals amazingly and again, perfect attitude towards their jobs! I hope they're paid well!! Almost all the shows were timed so you could enjoy one after another instead of having to pick and choose which ones you seen and which ones you didn't ! Train ride was great!! Kids loved it !

Overall- perfect day out , and cheap enough! We brought food with us and saved on buying ! Will recommend !!

titulo: Needs some TLC and updates on website!
conteudo:
We visited the Safari today- we travelled from Alicante so took a taxi,a bus and another taxi to get to it and we'd planned on spending the guts of the day there as there's a pool/water slides/restaurants etc all under one roof... we arrived and if you have any discount vouchers, mention them as they cashier would have happily charged us the full amount if we hadn't asked about it!

It was BAKING hot, a lot of the enclosures had very little shade or water for the animals and I felt sorry for them. Our two children didn't seem to notice these things and were delighted that there were lions/tigers and giraffes!

The park is very spread out so make sure you bring loads of Sun cream/drinks etc and not flip flops!! The ground is gravelled and was very uncomfy by the end of the day!

The pool/slide wasn't open although it didn't state that on their website so check before you go!

One of the cafes/photo shop only take cash so bear that in mind and also note that even if you get there an hour before closing, you're charged full whack! ( We witnessed a very irate Spanish lady complaining about this- €79 for an hour!)

There is an indoor play area for kids inside one of the restaurants at an extra cost of €3 per child plus socks for €1 each... if your child eats there, play is included in the price.

The sea lion exhibition was definitely the highlight of the day- the trainer obviously loves his job and you could sense the bond between him and the sea lions- it was lovely to watch!!

The park closes at 6, we asked the reception staff to call us a taxi which they did, although we figured that maybe they get a cut from taxi call outs as our return fare was double what we paid on our way there?!

All in all, the kids did like it but I was disappointed..

We have now visited the zoo 4 times in the last 12 years as the grand kids grew up.
It trys, but now looks tired. The animal enclosure are small and have minimal stimulation for the animal s.
The show's are rushed and little translation is given.
This probably will be our last visit.
Good day out , young kids will enjoy here . We bought lunch and enjoyed the food . Had a splash in the pool too . Enjoyed the seal show . Will return .

titulo: Some of the animals looked a little worse for wear.
conteudo: Overall it was an enjoyable day. You could get close to most of the (Safe) animals and we fed the likes of Giraffes etc. It would be a good day out for the kids (I don't mean the goats) and there is plenty to look at.

titulo: A little bit too sad to be really enjoyable
conteudo:
Close to Santa Pola and Elche, the safari was almost a great day out. There are plenty of animals and shows but everything is a bit sad. The grounds, cages and enclosures just aren't very well maintained, and there is a lack of space for the animals. The staff clearly love their jobs and try hard, but the animals just look sad. We went when it was quieter at Easter so can imagine that it would be a tougher day when busier and hotter later in the season.

It's not cheap either and they take every opportunity to get more money from you once inside. With investment in more space and refurbishment I could be a great place for the animals and a great day out.

Visited here recently, 3 adults and 3 kids and had a really enjoyable visit. The park is quite expensive but we used an offer advertised on the website so it is worth checking. The park is fairly big but walkable and has a nice train ride around where you can see the animals before setting off on foot. You can feed giraffes and watch some shows.

Parrot, sea lion and bird of prey shows were all very good. It is definitely worth a visit and the souvenirs, key rings, photos etc are very reasonably priced too. Lovely visit enjoyed by all.

titulo: 3 time visiting and kids love it
conteudo: It may not be the most modern safari however our 5 and 3 year old have a great time here. It has animals you can feed, a safari tour, and a sea lion show. It also has a nice little soft play and pool. A lovely family day out.

Our son is a big fan of zoos and animal parks so we had to visit this one as well. If someone has a lot of time to spend around Alicante with kids it might worth a visit, however we didn't really like the place. The whole park looks quite plain and mostly worn out and/or old, and the lack of maintenance is obvious everywhere. The sea lion exhibition is definitely not a show. The bird show is so-so (but hallelujah, it was in English!). The place was actually quite depressing and made me think that some animals were depressed as well. It is off season currently so it might be normal that it's dirty and there are huge areas being actually closed or worked on by construction machines and workers. But there will be a lot of work till the place will look good finally...

I had heard mixed reports about Rio Safari Elche but we had a child coming to stay with us and animals seemed like a sure fire winner.

We bought the tickets online which saved us 3 or 4€ per person.

The site looks a bit scruffy when you arrive and it's the same as you walk to the ticket office. The place looks like it needs a refit and a spring clean. In fact it's like that all the way round but it's a homely sort of scruffy and you soon stop noticing.

The pens and enclosures seem like they could do with a bit of money spending on them but the animals look in reasonable enough condition and happy enough if you think that animals in captivity can ever look happy. There's plenty to see. We missed all the scheduled shows and even our ride on the train in the three or four hours we were there but we were still finding new things to gawp at before we left. In fact we intended to go back in after lunch but, children being children, we went on to the beach at Santa Pola instead.

The restaurant by the way said self service but we got table service. Prices were a bit high for very ordinary (plato combinado style) food but it was perfectly reasonable. If I were doing it again I would be happy to eat there a second time. Oh, and we bought a few drinks and crisps at one of the bars somewhere in the park and the prices there were on the top side compared to street prices but nothing outrageous.

All in all we had a good time for a reasonable price.

We loved the safari park. There are various shows through out the day that they alert you too with music, they are also listed on the brochure and map you get on entry. We saw the sea lion and the bird show which were really good. There is also a trailer pulled by a truck that takes you through the enclosures to get a closer look at the animals. Which we went on twice as we liked it. There is a cafe/restaurant at the entrance that you can go to. Once you have purchased a ticket you are free to go in and out of the park. Inside the park are various kiosks selling snacks and refreshments. We were privileged enough to witness the birth of a baby lama. I'm going back in the summer to take my other grandchildren as I know they will love it as much as I did.

I got to hand feed a giraffe!!!!! Enough said I think.......
The safari park is a brilliant day out for all ages, we loved it and would go back again any time!

Lovely staff, good day out. Shows were well organized. Parrot show is a must, a very funny bilingual Spanish man getting the parrot to do tricks and the children loved it.Good size park not too big to get around.

titulo: great day out for the whole family
conteudo: Had a great day out. Loads to do. Nice play area for the kids and really good picnic area. The whole place was very clean and the enclosures looked really well kept. The staff were really friendly. Enjoyed the shows too. We had half price tickets so we thought this was extremely good value for money. Being February it was really quiet and easy to get around, get seats for the shows and get served in the restaurant. Won't be so easy later on in the year and without the half price tickets, not sure we would go in the summer. Downsides were the pool area not being open but it's too cold anyway and the go-kart track was closed for maintenance. Otherwise, a really nice park in a nice setting.

I liked this Safari park before, it had boats going around (Rio means river) and everything was more green.
Now you have to go in some kind of train and the spirit is gone, also quite dirty and dusty.
I find it super expensive € 22,- for coming in, thats why probably there was almost nobody there, if they make it more payable then they probably get much more people.
Outside the park there is a restaurant that seems to belong to the park, the food is good and all home made.
Bernie's World Wide Travel Experience.
Low season and you have the zoo almost for yourself. The kids (3 and 7 year old) had a fabulous day! No resturant inside so one tip is to bring food if you want to stay a while.

Amazing day with family loved it will be back this year. Photos were much more reasonable priced than normal places similar to it. We took our own picnic so can't comment on the food. Pool with the slide was a great bonus!

I visited this zoo with my 5 year old on the 3rd of November. Even though it was off season there was lots to see there. The scheduled shows are really good and the staff get the kids involved. In fact the staff in general are fantastic, very friendly and helpful.
You can really get up close with some of the animals,the giraffes and camels came close enough to touch.It is a really nice walk around the zoo and is well shaded for those hotter days.
Food in the restaurant is quite good,with a nice selection to choose from and reasonably priced.
I would definitely recommend a visit if you are in the area.

titulo: Late October visit with young children
conteudo:
A very entertaining and educational visit. Children 3 to 12.they thoroughly enjoyed it and particularly the petting area. Visited also two years ago. Late in year so pool closed but several shows and many animals. They all looked healthy. Some beautiful tigers.
One reviewergave a poor review on this web site but must have visited on a very hot day when animals sleep.

It was a cool day when we went, if I'd gone in the summer it would have been too much. Rather expensive cost over 80 euro for 4 adults and 1 child and we had a coupon for money off, was quite a good day. Lots to see if would go again if it wasn't so expensive.

Visited in October half term with my husband and 2 children. They loved the reptile house and the train ride. They were also amazed by the tigers. The shows were good and just the right length
There was a lot of maintenance going on but it was the end of their season.

The zoo itself is slightly run down and health and safety isn't exactly priority clearly but it's nice and spaced out, it was lovely how it wasn't busy! It's a nice zoo compared to others abroad. Swimming the sea lions is so worth the money!! €35 I think but it was amazing!! 30 minutes but felt like an hour

titulo: A wonderful day in the sun!!
conteudo: I took my younger brother here back in August to celebrate his birthday. It was slightly expensive however we both had such a wonderful day. We had a train ride through the animal enclosures which was brilliant and then we had a walk around taking lots of photos. We then bought slushies from the little on site shop and bought some nuts and fed the giraffes from our mouths!! It was our favourite part of the day! We went to a seal show which was fab and had some lunch in the picnic area. After a long day in the sun, we then went for a swim in the pool on site which was so lovely. Definitely coming back here!

This Zoo is lovely and I was amazed at how close we got to feed animals like a giraffe and hippo.
The animals were well kept and the day was hot so many animals were asleep to start with but soon were awake and happy.
Highly recommend this place. Children would love this.
Little train ride and many animal shows but make sure you make a note of the show times. You can have pics taken with animals such as the seal and parrots for €8 and it was a nice big pic.
There is a restaurant / cafe place which had flies over the food. We had chips and drink. Reasonable price.
