It's ok to leave and come back again so you could take a picnic. There is lots of picnic benches throughout the zoo.
Nice petting zoo for children.

titulo: Great day out, offred so much more than we expected.
conteudo: From being greeted by the charming car park attendant our day was full of laughter and joy, great to be up close and hand feeding giraffes, take salad and fruit bits to feed them you wont be disappointed. The seal show although only took 25 mins was entertaining and grsat for close up photos. Would definitely return, best to pick a cloudy/cooler day and shoes you dont getting dusty. The animals appear well fed and looked after.

Animals were very lethargic, looked ill and some close to death, overheard one couple thankful that one of the young Lammas finally moved as thought it was dead. These animals need rescuing. On secondary points restaurants and toilet facilities were basic to poor. All in all shut the place down and save the animals.

Went to Rio Safari on Tuesday, and had a wonderful day looking round. It's not a huge site but there is plenty to look at. The animal housing is very good for most of the animals, there is some older housing but this is being phased out. A very good day out, some wonderful photo opportunities.

titulo: lovely day out at the zoo
conteudo: This zoo is very charming,went with husband and mother-in-law ,booked it through a tour company,as soon as you arrive there is lots to do,as well as enjoying all the animals you can join in with the shows that are put on for your entertainment,the bird show which ends with all the parrots flying over you,have your cameras ready,a trip on the land train great fun,and the seal lion show wonderful,didn`t like the photo opportunity after though,but thats my choice.There is a lovely cafe at the entrance and a pool with loungers around it,Had a great day,

A great place to spend a day with kids, see and feed numerous animals, when visiting Spain! Plenty entertainment shows with sea lions, parrots and birds of pry and other creatures. We went on a short tour onboard Land Rover trains, all this included in a reasonably priced entry fee. Helped by the very warm weather of course!
Great day out with our 2 year old x we all had a fabulous day x x 2nd visit and not disappointed x will come again next year x parrot show is definitely worth sitting through x x

We stayed in calasparra so it was a bit of a drive for us to get to the zoo but we set off early to avoid the peak of the heat. The zoo was easy to find and signposted well along the way. Even the guy working as car park attendant was very informative.

When we got to the entrance to the park we realised it was possible to swim with the sea lions! I wish we had known this before as we definitely would have done this. Everyone looked to be having great fun!

The zoo has a lot of different animals to see and had a variety of shows for all to enjoy. I would definitely recommend the sea lion show.

I didn't rate the restaurant as there was so many flies in there which I suppose can't be helped, and I didn't try the pool so I couldn't comment on that. However it's good to have a pool available as you will constantly be in the sun whilst walking around the zoo!

I would recommend anyone in the area to give this zoo a try! I will definitely be returning when I go back to Spain!

We stopped off at Rio Safari as we had a 6pm flight and had to be out of our apartment in the morning. They have a good range of animals but the park is not very big. You can see most things on the jeep safari tour they take you on which is included in the price of your entrance ticket. It is very dusty so wear sensible shoes and there are lots of mosquittos and flies around. The animal housing is rather basic which some visitors may not like. There is a pool area and water slide so take your swim suit. However the showers are very basic, not particularly clean and some do not work. The children appeared to enjoy the visit and it passed some time while waiting for our flight but I wouldn't want to return anytime soon.

Awkward to review because if we don't go then it will be the animals in the park that suffer first,,,,

You do get very close and in some cases upfront and personal with many of the animals ,,,,

You can ,,,, if you pre book ,,, swimming with the sea lions at the park which is really fantastic but be aware this will cost you 35 euros per person.
Please note you can just book that experience and not actually have to pay to enter the park as well,

this experience was super the kids loved it, the sea loins love it and it was so much better and 5 times cheaper than swimming with the dolphins in Orlando USA

But the park itself is dirty, toilets don't work and no running water at the sinks, no toilet roll and worst of all,,, some one done a number 2 on the floor, how gross can people be !!!

So overal , average day out 20 euros per person to enter the park , plus included is the use of the swimming pool out the front

Camel rides 8 euros per person, boring, but what do you expect a camel to do, except spit at you, lick you and chuck you off !!!

Would not recommend the 'go carts' unless you have super travel insurance and your on a death wish !!!

But:

Swim with sea lions , just do it,,, it's fantastic , take your swimming stuff and 35 euros, pre book, the number is on their web site

On site photos are quite expensive and

safari train,,, well you can decide on that ,,,be ready for the emu's !!!

Have a nice day and enjoy the shows
Had a great day out here loved every minute. Great shows and loved seeing the animals. Plenty of places to stop for a drink or ice lolly.

titulo: Easy to find on the road from Santa Pola
conteudo: Overpriced. Apart from sea lions animals looked underfed. Driving around on the tour no stops for photos ,if you wanted to take any. the man doing the shows was good at his job and had a bit of humor.

titulo: Brilliant day out for all ages
conteudo: Traveled here last week as a young couple. The shows were entertaining, interactive and informative. Staff were excellent and very helping, even providing free use of lockers for valuables. Wide range of exotic animals, and they even allow you to feed most of the animals with peanuts which are sold on site. Plenty of shops/ restaurants and picnic areas if you choose to bring your own food/drink. Lovely pool area and slide for all to enjoy. Brilliant place to bring kids, with lots of families, young and old couples all enjoying the time. Would definitely go back sometime and maye avail of the option to swim with the sealions!!
Very good day out for the kids and reasonably priced if you get your tickets online with the discount.love the fact the giraffes are so friendly and eat gently out of your hand and my son loves it
Fun for the whole family. The giraff was realy friendly, you should go to the shops inside and buy nuts to feed the animals

titulo: Visit to the Zoooooo with small children
conteudo:
We were staying Quesada with our 2 children (2&3) and were looking for a day out.

We had read about Rio Safari and decided to give it a go...

We got there early figuring that the park might be a empty first thing and it was.

The weather was baking but this did not detract from the experience.

If you are going to a zoo in Spain in August - it's going to be hot!

We were there for about 3 hours with our children and they got to see/ feed animals - eat ice cream - watch animal shows and seemed to enjoy themselves :-)

There is lots of space here and it was a good day out.

EXPECT IT TO BE HOT IN SUMMER!

On arrival we were greeted by lovely staff who spoke English as well as Spanish which was comforting. We managed to get in with a coupon that offered us 4 euros off each which was good. I like how the tour spoke in both Spanish and English accommodating for most people! There were many different animals to see. However at taking a closer look at their pens, there was little.. If not any water that we could see as well as minimal shading for them. We were also shocked at how small some of the enclosures were for such large animals! The sea lion show was brilliant and there are plenty of places to get food and refreshments. All in all a good time seeing the animals up close and personal.. Just a shame about some of their living conditions!

titulo: Excelent place to be with kids
conteudo: Many attractions for kids. Nice restaurant with fresh made Paella. Lots of wild animals and Safari ride atound :)

We went to the Rio Safari zoo today. We had an amazing time: lots of animals, very easy to view them all, giraffes eating in your hands as well as zebras etc. Our kids for to swim with sea lions, and had a great experience touching the sea lion (35 euros and previous booking needed). The zoo seems very respectful of its animals and the staff is helpful. There is also an outdoor swimming pool. We lived the time spent there, the numerous animals we got to see, the hospitality of the staff. We would definitely recommend going there if you are on vacation with kids in the Alicante area. The only negative side is the entrance fee, which you can reduce by bringing a reduction coupon (which you can find in all tourist information booth or print on the Internet).

I went here with my family. My parents, sister and partner. We had a lovely day out but it was hot, too HOT, which meant that most of the animals were scrambling for a very small amount of shade within the enclosures. Most of the enclosures were small and a little dirty but that is the norm with any 'zoo' type situation. I do think it's worth a visit and I'm sure the charge does go somewhat towards the animals.
Price for adult is €22.50, however u can get discount coupons in loads of places that give you €4 off.

amazing place. friendly staff that try their best to understand our English. free scooter hire for my disabled mother and reduced rate for her. also gave us a €4 off each voucher which saved us €24! there is a water park attached which is free to use once you've paid entry. the safari train (jeep and carriages) was great and too us close up to the animals. drinks cost were what you would expect - about €1-€1.50 each. lots of places to get refreshments and they also do English tea! lots of animals to see and also camels you can ride. €8 euro per child for 3 loops round a couple of trees was very very expensive but you can get a photo with a baby python for €7 per photo which isn't bad. after you've been on the safari train there is magnets and key rings available at €3 each. nice family day out. could defo spend a full day here! also pictures and swimming with sealions for €35 pp. we didn't do this but it's much cheaper then the water park in benadorm.

I went to the safari in August witch means it was very hot but lots of shade to keep cool, very interactive with the animals for €2 for a bag of food !! Animals all well kept , happy and friendly , great day out lots to see and do, great deal for the safari and the water parc , all staff were really nice and helpful with all languages, definitely recommend, would love to go again , lots of little shops around to re-stock of get a drink crisps ice pops and lots more.. Suitable for all ages 👍🏼👍🏼O.M

This is the second time we have visited and both times we were not disappointed. Both my son aged 13 and daughter aged 7 absolutely enjoyed it as did we. The highlight were the chimps and the giraffes. Such an amazing park particularly as you can get so close to the animals. We will be visiting again when we are in the area as we live in Cornwall. This was the highlight of our holiday both times. We also enjoyed the bird show which we did not particularly want to watch as birds are not our thing but we were pleasantly surprised and thought the man who did the show had the whole crowd entertained and thought he was great with the animal and could tell he enjoys his job. Fantastic zoo!!

The condition the animals are living in are very poor.There was no water in the cages and pens..The animals were very hungry...The poor little donkey had wax hanging from its ear ...The condition of most of the animals feet were terrible..How can this zoo get away with these poor conditions ..I came away most upset...Surely there must be standards that the zoo has to abide with ....

This is a great family day out, there's lots of different animals and you can feed the giraffes peanuts. There's lots of interactive activities and there is also a water park at the front of the zoo which is a bit random.

Didn't enjoy 1 bit. These poor animals had little to drink and little shelter it's so barren there nothing for them poor animals I even complained to a member of staff to how thin one of the pigs was. If you go please take a little food for these poor creatures it bothered me all day bout these poor animals The poor crocodiles had little water too swim in if you like animal pls avoid going

Visited the park with a mixture of adults and children aged from 6 to 14. Everyone had a great time as there was something for everyone. We paid extra to swim with the sealions a great experience something everybody really enjoyed, if you are in the area it's well worth a visit. It's not an expensive day out and I wouldn't bother with a packed lunch as meal deals can be purchased for 10euro( something with chips,a drink and ice cream)

titulo: More of a prison than a zoo
conteudo: Walked in got a 15 mins train ride around the tiny enclosures. Then had a 45 minute walk around looking into the tiny pools and enclosures at the depressed and lifeless animals then we walked out. If your an animal lover don't go unless you don't really care and just want a cheap day out and see some lifeless animal

Today on the 4th August 2016 we went to the rio safari, we were told not to expect much so we didn't have high expectations anyway. When we got there we were given a map of a train that would take us around the park so you could be close to the animals, giraffes,monkeys etc but the journey was 20mins long and all we basically saw were lamas, so we had a walk around The enclosures themselves were DISCUSTING they were too small for each of the animals,there wasn't much area for them to lay in the shade during that heat, hardly any food and could barely see any water for them to drink. In my opinion it should either get massively improved or shut down, what they have there is cruelty to animals.

After being recommended to visit by a friend, I was appalled to find what was supposed to be a well kept animal sanctuary.

It was heartbreaking to see animals kept in such conditions.

The crocodiles were in pools that had very little water and what was there, was filthy dirty filled with rubbish, empty paint tins and rotting food.

The rest of the area was barren , no shade for the animals, they looked totally neglected.

They had camels before you entered the park, where you could ride if you wished, these poor animals were walked around the entrance area the entire time we were there.

The only area that seemed to be kept well was the area with the seals and sea lions.
Our granddaughter loves seals so we had booked the seal experience for her. If I had known how bad the safari park was, we would never have went anywhere near it.

We looked at the pool area but it was too crowded to get anywhere near it, but again was not very clean.
Hopefully something will be done to improve this  safari park

My wife has a fascination with zoos and which ever country we travel too we have to go to a zoo/safari.

This was a zoo that looks like it needs a bit of money spending on the enclosures as they look a bit run down to be fair.

But the train ride through the zoo was fantastic as you got very close to the animals and the shows were very good. A must see is the sea lions - exceptional creatures!

The zoo itself is quite small which is actually ideal in the heat of summer but is certainly worth a visit to break the day up. There is even a pool to cool down in at the end there is go karting next door of you want to make a day of it.

Worth every penny!!!

this is a relatively small zoo with the opportunity to get close to the animals.There is a land train which takes you around the enclosures which is great fun for kids.There are a few shows throughout the day but be sure to check the website before you go to plan your day.You can then walk round and visit the animals at your own pace.Feeding the giraffes is great and something kids enjoy with them taking food out of your hand.There are eating places but you can take your own food so put it in a cool box and go and get it when you are ready.Swimming with sea lions is available but pre book due to limited spaces.There is also a swimming pool so when finished in the park go and have a dip.

Loved wandering around here looking at all of the animals. My daughter was very excited to feed the giraffe and the giraffe seemed happy too. Great little ride around the animals on a truck so we got a really good view.
Lovely little coffee shop on the way out and a pool which is free to use with entry on the park.
Would definitely recommend a visit here if in the area.

Trying to please teenagers and keep them amused on holiday is a nightmare but my 14 year old daughter loved it here. Although it is a small zoo there was lots to see and do. The eating place was also very nice and reasonably priced. We finished the day in the pool. Thoroughly enjoyed by the whole family.

recently went to this zoo whilst on holiday in spain. we had a dull day so took kids to the Rio Safari, you get so close to the animals such as lions and tigers, it really is a cracking place and all the animal shows are great too. highly recommend it if you are sick of the beach and pool whilst on holiday

Ideal for a young family not too big. We arrived around 10 so it was not too busy, toilets were very clean. Sea lion show was fantastic, the kids loved it. Food expensive, and not great quality but that is the case in any zoo,and we didn't go for the food. It was very hot when we went, 33 degrees would be a much better day out on a cooler day.

titulo: I need of some serious maintenance
conteudo: Although we had a good time , the park is a bit run down and many of the animals look a bit sad (I know it's a zoo , bla bla). Many of the birds seemed to be a bit stressed , pulling out their own feathers etc. All that said , it's entertaining for the little ones and lots of animals too see

The animals didn't seem interested it was to hot and not a lot of shelter in the shade. The safari ride around was good. There was donkeys and piggies that look really tired and had no fresh water for them to drink my daughter loves to feed the animals but I would not visit again.

It was ok. And definitely worth doing if you have young kids. But the set up was slightly disappointing. The giraffe wasn't at his feeding station, there was lots of building work being done, and the one show we saw (parrots) was underwhelming.... It was an expensive day that didn't include many oooohs and aaaaahs on our part. The food is awful. Take a picnic.

There is a free bus to the zoo. You have to book the transportation in advance in one of the Rio Safari stands. We booked ours in Zenia mall. The bus picked us up from Cabo Roig in front of Apartmenthotel Diamant Blue. It drove through Torrevieja and lots of people hopped on there. I don't know where exactly. The bus costs 4€/person but you get a 4€discount from the entrance fee in the zoo with your busticket. You can't get a discount with the discount coupon from internet or Ikea-card if you use the bus service. The zoo itself is ok. Thesafari train tour was very short and truly a disappoinment. The pics about it in the brochure look a lot more exciting than it really is. It was boring, short and you didn't get anything extra (you get a better look at the animals on foot. The parrot show and the sealion show were very entertaining/fun/exciting/animals were adorable. Make sure you take water with you to the sealion show as you will be sitting in a direct sunlight. 0,5l of water costs 1€ in the zoo but 1,50€ in the kiosk inside the arena. After the show you can have your pic taken holding a parrot or next to the big sealion for 8€. You can feed the ciraffes, just like for example in Budapest zoo. A bag of peanuts for the ciraffes cost 2€.
Bring your swimmers and towel as there is a pool and a waterslide too + free sunbeds. That is great as the bus back to Torrevieja/Cabo Roig left at 5pm (arrived at the zoo at 10.30am) and it would've been waaaaay too long time to just look at the animals.
Bring your own food/snacks/something to eat! Food in the zoo is absolutely horrible s...t!
They say everything in the zoo is included to the entrance fee, but the pony/camel ride cost 5€ and the go karts aren't free either.

Visited on a very hot World Giraffe Day in June. Straight onto the train which was very good with commentary in English. Then spent the day going round the whole site having a closer look at everything. Lots and lots to see and it would be very easy to spend the whole day here. The shows are very good. Lots of places to get away from the sun as well if it does get a bit too hot.

Visited recently was very surprised by diversity of animals. Well set out so you do not miss anything. You can buy peanuts when you go in to feed the giraffes, really up close experience. Good facilities for drinks, ice creams etc. You can exit and re enter if you take your own food. Animal shows also included. On site go kart track and take your swimmers as onsite swimming pool available. Very open, take a drink and a hat or visit at cooler times of the day.

titulo: Great day out with the family
conteudo:
Shaded and compact we were able to enjoy watching the sea lions, close enclosures enable everyone to see the animals and see them enjoying their surroundings.
The children's zoo was a hit as many of the animals had small babies too! Our grand daughter loved stroking the goats.
Shaded areas for picnics. Internet voucher enables a 4 € discount on admission prices as well as discount price for pensioners.

I would really recommended going if you find yourself with nothing to do!!, it was Surprisingly a great day out but it's more of a half day out as the Zoo isn't massive like in London for example but it has loads of different animals and worth a visit!.

If you pay online you get a €4 discount per ticket which works out to about €18 each but this includes everything within the park!. They have a safari ride which takes you around inside enclosures so you get a close up look with most animals!. You also get all shows included and would really recommend going to see the Sea Lion show!!.

A typical old style zoo suitable for a half day activity. There's a land train ride through various parts going through (or quite close to) the enclosures. The bird of prey display was quite good. I still find it hard to accept seeing big cats and larger animals in small cages though.

Nice zoo lots to see they have a pool area open in the warmer weather with slides for the little ones. The animals could do with a bit more to do like thinks in there cages seemed a bit bored,need more stimulation.

titulo: Great day for all the family
conteudo: Great day out. Buy the monkey nuts to feed the animals, what great fun, hilarious to have a 18ft+ giraffe following you round after the nuts, don't forget the wet wipes though. The safari train was good and when you buy the entrance tickets, the time of your train trip is stamped in your park plan, so everyone gets a seat with no pushing or queue jumping. All animals looked well cared for and enclosures clean. Go on enjoy.

In April 2016 me and my sister visited this zoo. At the gate, when we had just finished to pay the tickets a nice young woman comes up to us with a giant snake (Albino Burmese Python) and asked if we wanted to hold it. Oh boy, was I scared. We decided to walk through the garden and THEN hold the big snake. Which we did, and we got a picture of us holding it. It was frightening but absolutely worth it. For those who don't like walking too much, there is a train in the zoo that goes anywhere. At the gate, when you up the ticket you also get a map of the areas and a schedule.

I recommend this zoo 100% for all ages 😄
this was the best ever day out, we were so close to animals,and the shows were great,my son loved it as did we.

Visited in late April, not too busy or hot. Good value for money although there is a charge of 1€ for car park outside safari park. Grandchildren loved been able to run freely (within reason) through the park to see all the different animals. Sea lion show brilliant and the train ride through the park good but check out times they run. Lots of picnic areas but take lots of sun hats/creams as not that much shade when walking around.

titulo: Quite large Safari Park with Seals, African animals, a Train Tour and a Swimming Theme Park
conteudo:
An expansive Safari park, which houses seals in a custom pool, lions, tigers, monkeys, giraffes, baby hippos and all manner of animals roaming almost freely! You can walk round the outside fences to take your time looking at the animals, and you can also take a mini-train tour of the Park, to save you walking, though there are tables and benches dotted about! The animals are well looked after and appear very healthy and contented, generally ignoring the public! At the end of the tour of the park, you can visit the restaurant / cafe for a drink and a bite to eat! If you still have plenty of energy, you can also pop into the swimming pool, which has chutes, for a cool down!
Very entertaining and reasonably priced! To be recommended if you like Safari Parks!

Great safari park , get up close and stroke the giraffes and ostrich is you dare , Safari trip is good and inc in price as well as daily shows and you can pay extra to swim with sea lions. There is a farm also. Go karts and a free to use pool and slide in the summer months , easy to find and free parking.

You can go in and out for free with your ticket same day and they do discount with ikea family card or €4 off pp with leaflet.

titulo: Absolutely awesome a great day out
conteudo: We visited here in April as our son loves animals. We had heard mixed messages but had a brilliant time. Some of the animal enclosures are a bit small, but most were brilliant with the stand out enclosure being the tiger pen. It's superb being able to get so close to the animals. We can not recommended this place enough if you are in the area, but we would recommend you taking a picnic as the food prices are on the high side. We would also recommend the sea lion show, it's very entertaining and very funny. We would also recommend the free safari train which takes you through some of the bigger animals.

titulo: Family visit whilst on holiday with an age group from 80 down to 12
conteudo:
Interesting well set out park accessible both on foot and by trailer train which is included in the price. Shows at different times of day showing parrots and sea lions - the sea lion show was very entertaining and informative and monies go to a foundation helping endangered species. The usual photographers are around for group photos and photos with animals/reptiles.
Train gives passengers close proximity to the big cats etc.

We visited here with our 2 young daughters. It really reasonably priced for a day out - about £50 (although we did have some vouchers which gave us about £15 off). The girls loved it - the train ride is brilliant, worth the money on its own.

You can buy a bag of monkey nuts for about 2 euros and feed pretty much all the animals, the giraffes were the best.

I've seen some reviews saying the food is poor, but there's plenty of picnic areas for you to take your own food. There's also some decent snack stands to get a drink or an ice cream.
origem: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, UK

conteudo: Came here a few years ago, and again in March 2016 with our little kid. Well priced with undercover picnic area and place to eat if you want to.
I dont know if its since we where of season, but most of the animals looked like they were unhappy and placed inn small spaces. And the food was awfull, bring your own

We went here early march so it was very quiet, suited me has I love animals better than humans so spent more time with them! It cost 25 euros each including transport which is good value has its an hour journey to elche . The park is well kept with a few shows for you to watch like parrots and sealions all are very good so look out for the times of the shows. You are very close up to the animals which I liked best especially the giraffes they were fab! Never realised how tall they were until your up close, they have a safari train which tales you inside the enclosures included in the price and its great. There are several eateries throughout the park with good toilet facilities and places to sit and rest, takes about 4 hours to enjoy this wonderful park. Make sure you get your pictures taken with the parrots sealions ect they are good pries about 7 euros each and come in a nice frame. Well done to all the keepers and staff who look after these fabulous animals one of the best parks for me that ive visited and ive been to many!.
I took my grandchildren here for a day out, they throughly enjoyed their time there, this is a small place compared to some in England but it is clean and friendly and a lot of fun

titulo: Great day out but beware the photographer
conteudo:
We had a really lovely day here in February. The park is nicely kept and the animals seem very close to you as you walk around. I have never got so close to a giraffe before. It was also great to see the orangutans and the other primates. A highlight for me was the little Safari train that takes you around the enclosures and into the midst of some of the animals .
There are good toilet facilities for visitors and places to eat and drink . The Safari Park is easy to find and there is plenty of free parking.
I must point out however a major problem when we arrived. As soon as we had paid and got into the entrance we were asked to pose for a photograph. That was fine and we did not feel harassed. However we were very unhappy with what happened next. The female photographer opened a box next to us and took out an enormous snake for us to pose with. I am completely phobic about snakes and screamed and ran away shaking. It took me a long time to compose myself to enjoy the trip around the park . We feel that rather than just take out a snake the photographer should ask if we agree . Luckily I still managed to enjoy the day but for this incident alone this has become a three-star review and we want to warn guests and management .

titulo: Great day out and lovely lunch
conteudo: Visited the zoo.. great value for money. Good shows. . At the zoom in show. .we were the only family watching and he was still fantastic. Well organised and lovely train ride. Meal was lovely. .had pork baguettes and chips. . Good value!

Pleasantly surprised at the quality of the surroundings and the condition of all of the animals. The shows could have been a little longer perhaps half an hour instead of 20 minutes. Well worth a visit.

You can do it all under 3 hours inluding the train and the sealionshow. Some animals don't have according to me not enough space. Strange that not the train are electric driven when they are around the animals. The zoo has to rethink in this matter. March was good time to visit

Reasonably priced plenty to do and see. Take swim wear as there is a pool and slide open in summer. Restaurants are very good and polite. There is also a Go-Kart track this costs extra but is a good circuit.

titulo: really good day out for the family
conteudo: great place to go but check to make sure pool open too - food is very expensive so good to take a picnic and leave in car until ready to eat - plenty of picnic areas and if you get too hot you can go for a dip in the pool or swim with the sealions although best to buy this special ticket and get free entry to parc with it

titulo: Like in Africa - Super day out in Elche!!
conteudo: Been there with my cousin and it is worth the price. Beautiful animals and shows and lovely staff. I went to several safaris and zoos and this one was one of the greatest. Highly recommended if you are in the Elche area!!

titulo: The best zoo I have been to
conteudo: Visiting here made our holiday, the variety of animals and shows were fantastic and I didn't feel ripped off. There is a great pool area as well do take your costumes and chill out after, you really can spend the whole day here either as a cooper, family or slime, I really recommend a visit.

We have been to Rio Safari about eight or nine times which will tell you how much we enjoy it. We bring our Grandchildren here and they love it, the animals always appear to be well kept without showing any signs of stress. We have seen the development of the place over the years and they seem to have the animal welfare well under control with the new Orang-utan facility being a good example. The animal presentations are entertaining and at about 15 minutes they are not too long for us or the animals. We have photos of our grandchildren as they have grown taken on the safari trucks; they always seem to take great photos and at reasonable cost too. The food and drink cafe and kiosks are also good value and quality of the food is good as well. We shall be back there next year with our youngest grandchild for another photo. We usually go before or after July and August as we prefer the cooler times, so we haven’t experienced the water park which is part of the attraction.

For a place which states they are dedicated in the salvation of all these great animals, I think personally they would all be better off in a human prison.. at least this way they would have clean facilities, WATER and shelter from the scorching heat.
I saw at least 3 enclosures where the animals had not even been securely closed in, posing danger to themselves and the public.
At least 3/4 of the Croc pens had little or NO water in. They have roughly 40 turtles with not even a large puddle of water to use.
The pens are not large enough for the 4 white lion (large) cubs - with only a small apparatus to make use of - again no water/ shelter in site.
One quarantined animal was left in a box cage with straw, no water and in direct sun light.
I couldn't even begin to describe the mess of the sheep/ goats and the conditions they are being forced to live in and what the public are given to walk through to view them.
Absolutely appalling conditions. They should be completely ashamed of themselves.
Says it all when an 8 year old child comments on how cruel it all is.
I'd wished I put the extortionate amount of money to get in to good use with a Spanish animal rescue centre or at least a few gallons of water!!!

We visited here the last week of september the zoo is an amazing place and i highly recommend it. My father came with us and he can't walk very far the zoo had electric chairs it made his day so much better and there was no charge. The staff were helpful and friendly.The best part was the train ride inside some of the animal componds so we got really close to the animals my personal favourite was i got to stroke a giraffe it was my highlight.There is some building work going on but this can only make a great place better.We would definitly go back.

We had a very nice time at this zoo.
The kids especially enjoyed being able to feed the animals, the giraffes in particular.
I also appreciated the smallness of the area as I had children with me (although I am sure the animals do not appreciate this as I do).

We went to both the parrot and sealion show and enjoyed them.
It is also fun to go on the safari ride, which is complementary.

I am in two minds about how to review this attraction because my family did enjoy the visit but some of the conditions that the animals are kept in are not exactly ideal. On the positive side - the seal/ sea lion show is very entertaining and they appear happy, many of the animals on the safari have plenty of space to roam ( although the whole safari area is just barren dry earth with not a blade of grass in sight) and the catering is reasonable. The negatives are that some of the animals really do not appear to have enough room- crocodiles, monkeys near the entrance and two baby hyenas who pear to be kept on a birdcage no more than 10 feet across spring to mind. Also the safari train spends ages in an area full of cows and lamas but the when you come to the interesting stuff ( lions etc) you can barely see them and they don't slow or stop to let you get a better view. The cost is around 22 euros per adult and 14 per child over 3 ( think we got a discount with a leaflet) which on balance is expensive for what you get, however my kids did enjoy it and it is worth coming. Last thing make sure you put mosquito repellent on as the animals, heat and water are a perfect combination and we did get eaten alive!

titulo: Run down - depressing to see some of the animals
conteudo: Read some reviews before we went about poor conditions and animal welfare and we were thinking, just a few animal activists, however it did actually influence our experience as well. Just a few of each species in small cages, you felt sorry for them, and that is a bit unlikely for us to say, as we are not that into animals.

I went there with my family, we were pretty much dissapointed. first of all it was just too expensive. Moreover they dont even let you take a photo with the seal, they take you a photo and to collect it you have to pay 20 euros. they are goddam thieves. we saw animals in such poor conditions. the tigers didnt even have much space, they must be suffocated. i wouldnt like if someone put me in a cage, these animals must be sad. they need to improve the conditions otherwise the results will be that those animals wont survive.

The zoo has a good variety of animals with good views of them on the high walk ways, a free train and swim voucher o n entry makes it very good value, I had a picture with a snake on entry too that cost only 7€, the shows were good, good choice of food, go-karting was a lot of fun, the pool was brilliant to finish the day off, the slide was ace, all in all a very good place for all ages.

We met the kindness and most attentive car park attended ( Javier )when we arrived and when we left after an enjoyable few hours viewing the animals, the children having camel and miniature pony rids and we finished with a few laps on the Go Karts, a good day out on a non beach day.

Well we wanted a day out away from the beach and to do something other than the normal and so we went to the Zoo. We got there early, so we did not have to rush around.
The Zoo is laid out well and the staff are good, we got to go to most of the shows- The parrots, the sea lions, the birds... at the end we joked on the cost of the photos, they tended to be 7 Euros! we did get some as they were nice to take home!

We were really surprised at the cost of food and drink, we are used to the silly prices in the UK at Zoo's and safari parks so to get things at reasonable prices was nice. I wished we had lunch a little later, the Paella looked amazing.

We had a great day and ended leaving very late, so a good time.

Good tip, you can get 4Euro's off each ticket if you pick up a booklet at the airport. It makes it even better!!

titulo: Beautiful animals and great days fun
conteudo: Amazing day. My family spent the whole day here. It was very hot. We pre booked the sealion swim which I recommend booking in advance to guarantee the swim. It lasted about 30 - 40 minutes and was great value for money. The animals look well cared for and you can feed most of the animals. The monkeys clapped at us and blew raspberries for monkey nuts. The most amazing part for me was the giraffes, they were so tame and friendly and you can feed them. I actually got a cuddle and slobbered on by one lol. I could have just stayed with the giraffes all day. They also provide camel rides and pony rides. Pictures are good value for money compared to most places. I wasn't keen on the buffet in the café but this was more me being fussy. I would recommend this as a family day out just remember to book the swim in advance and take a hat, sun cream and water and swim wear for the pool.
Took my daughter to swim with the sea lions,absolutely fantastic day out well run and worth a visit, took a picnic lunch with a lot of places to have your own food.

Arrived around noon for afternoon of fun and started off with birds of prey show which was a mix of small animals and owls etc very good show in English and Spanish.

Lunch menu is very limited with Spanish fair or toasted cheese sandwiches don't expect much more.

Afternoon in the zoo was great buy a €2 bag of monkey nuts and you with have every animal eating out of your hands including the giraffe who were so tame and friendly.

For a Spanish zoo animals are kept very clean and tidy way better value and standard than the one in murcia.

Highlight of the day sealion swim and daughter doing a camel ride ,good afternoon out but take a packed lunch :-)

We booked our tickets online which saved queuing to enter, we arrived about mid day, so we had a short walk around prior to watching the Sealion exhibition, which lasted about half a hour, seemed that from 14:00 to 15:00hrs all is quiet so a good time to have lunch, we had a picnic, as on previous visit the food was not to our taste.
At 15:00 we watched the bird exhibition,which was highly entertaining.
We were aware that at each show the handlers were very caring towards the animals.
We had a trip on the Train around the park which was equally entertaining.
All the animals looked healthy and happy, enjoyable day out, we would recommend it as a fine day out.

titulo: Typical low quality food at tourist attraction
conteudo: Typical food at tourist attractions. Low quality due to high turnover without the neccessary focus on the food. This is not a place I like to eat. However, the Rio Safari park itself is very nice. It is the food I am not happy with.

Loved this place...went on a safari drive and bought some lovely pics of kids at end. Parrot show was great kids got to sit in cage with lemurs and the lemurs sat on their knees and got fed ...amazing. Got loads of pics kids holding snakes owls parrots and feeding giraffes, recommend this place. Free car parking. We bought a picnic with us as there is a picnic area

Not the most posh zoo but well worth the visit if you don't mind searing heat and dust. The animals are brilliant , there is horse and camel rides available and a good seal and bird show. Eating venues are limited but just what you need . Cost wise ok but a good day out .

I first visited the Safari Park a few years ago and did not have a positive impression - but now is a different story. The park is vibrant and clean, a far cry from what it was. I am very pleased to say the breeding programme is showing fabulous results credit to all the staff there. The water park outside the Safari park is free to enter and has a terrific water slide and wonderful place to cool off either before or after visiting the Safari Park. The highlight of our visit was swimming with the sea lions, but if you want to swim then its a must to book early as spaces are limited. I highly recommend a visit if your anywhere near, the children loved it and so for that matter did the adults. Entry fee is very reasonable and concessions for the elderly and children.

This is a reasonably priced day out for a family (always check online for any offers).
We have visited on several occasions and its never busy which makes it even better.
Please check their website for all the animals but the white lions, giraffes (close encounter if your lucky) and many others are all wonderful to see close up.
We went in August and the temperatures were high but lucky enough there is a swimming pool to cool off in before continuing a tour of the park.
The food and drink is reasonably priced and you will get the chance for a few photo opportunities.... Sea lion and snake are just a few.
Overall, there's better zoo's but there's something different when walking around Rio Safari. You won't leave totally amazed but you will have a good family day out.

titulo: Revisited after 11 years and it's great now!!!
conteudo:
My wife and I visited this place 11 years ago and it was very run down, the animals look very unkept and the poor elephant looked very disturbed, we were reluctant to go back but now glad we did, we now have 3 young children of 9, 6 and 2 and they all said at the end of the day that it's was great and then all fell asleep in the car on the way back to the villa, we can quite clearly see that there has been a lot of investment made, and also the animals all looked well kept, the kids loved being able to feed the camels and giraffe, we didn't manage to get into the pool as it was to busy and had closed to to any more people.

Well worth a visit and also look out for the discount tickets int he local shops and petrol station

The zoo overall was really good. They have a restaurant, free swimming pool and a play park before the booths where you pay. The animals there were amazing, and all of them were very active. My faveourites were the Tigers (huge!) and the white lions. They had lots of shows and you could pre-book to swim with the sea-lions. It's a great day outfit all ages.

titulo: Wish I had visited before ....a gem
conteudo:
I have owned a house about 10mins away from Rio Safari for 13 years and I always meant to go there. I started to rent the house out and decided to visit a few local attractions.
What a gem ! I read about their conservation work with sea lions and some really bad reviews but well I will visit and make my own mind up.
Yes prices seem to have gone up but so have wages and the cost of food.
I thought it was value for money and we spent 4-5 hours there and could had some lunch and time at the great pool area.
I enjoyed the train ride ....and the giraffes were amazing .....so gentle and up close.
I am a horse owner and the horses were all well fed and better than a lot I have seen at stables in the region !
All in all highly recommended.......Heat can be an issue but hey it is Spain.

to say the animals are very poorly looked after ...you need glasses mate!!
In 20+ c heat they wont be doing a tango and neither would you !

The animals all seemed happy and well fed which is always my main concern. The park was undergoing work when i visited so id like to visit again to see if there are improvemnts on the animals living facilities as some were a tad old fashioned.

We had a nice visit to Rio Safari. We visited with 2 twelve year olds, a nine year old and a four year old, fun was had by all of them. All 3 shows were entertaining for them all. The sea lions were our favourite. Quite hot while you walk around some more shade and some sprinklers would be nice. Train ride was great getting to go close to some of the animals through their paddocks'. All staff, shows and tours are done in English and Spanish meaning almost everyone can understand.
Only main fall back is the aquatic park that is too small and overly crowded with only one slide and a small pool. It's worth skipping and going in the pool where you are staying.

titulo: Very disappointed. Animals look very poorly looked after.
conteudo: Visited here 4 years ago and had a great day. Visited today for our daughters 12th birthday and so disappointed and upset. This place has been really let go and the most worrying is the animals look in very poor condition. Especially the lions they look I'll and under feed. The elephant no longer here I hate to think why. And there is only one little hippo left in barely a foot of water. So very sad. It took us just an hour to get around it at the cost of 45 euro for the 3 of us and that was with a 30 % discount. I feel very sad now as I was not expecting to see these poor conditions. 😢

titulo: Well worth a visit but there is no sun escape in park!
conteudo: The zoo is pretty good and we actually swam with the sea lions which was really good but pricey! This was our second visit and prices have gone up so be sure to get the money of vouchers from various shopping centres and restaurants from surrounding areas .. In the park they have added a new little safari ride which takes you quickly around park so you can scope the area before adventuring your self which is good .. The animals do have mostly adequate space could maybe be slightly improved .. Lions and tigers need more shaded areas though definitely.. There's a slush machine in there which is help yourself once you have bought cup are amazing !! Buy one you need it to stay cool !! The shows are moderately ok .. Prob wouldn't go back again but we have been twice now so that shouldn't really be a negative point ..

We have been coming here for a few years and have not been since the upgrade. It doesn't have the same feel and the staff just want to take photo's of you and the family every second. The prices have increased a lot from entry,food and photo's. The seal show is good but get in early or you will be in the sun without shade okay for sun worshippers but not so good for young children . They have a parrot show and other shows at different times so you have time to walk around the park. The camels are good to see and very friendly you can buy animal food from the kiosks . they have a cafe outside of the park with a little aqua park but this does get full quickly. they do have picnic areas you can use.

Was a great day out with the kids despite the fact it was 40 degrees.

Have a great sea lion show, and a new baby seal.

Moral dilemma though. Conditions for a lot of the animals could be much better........so what do you do?! Avoid it and they get no money to make it better..or...go and they get funds to prove it!!

Decided that it will exist anyway so better to help fund improvements.

Was a good day out so hence gave it 3 due to the dilemma! The choice is yours.

We spent a few hours walking around this zoo. There was a good variety of animals, all looked well looked after. It was cheap entrance fee for adults and children. We didn't have any children with us but I am sure any child would be amazed at the selection there. There were some bridges but I would say it was disable friendly. There is plenty to see and do with rides and a pool.

Had a lovely day here in july. The sea lion show was great, was very nice to be able to have a picture took with one after the show too. We got to feed the giraffe which was good, and stroke the pigs. Only downfall was alot of the park was under construction when we visited so was a little disappointed, but glad they are improving the park..

titulo: Terrible animal welfare, below all standards, the worst place I have ever been with animals.
conteudo:
My family and i visited this zoo in 2014 and i still remember it well for all the wrong reasons. I'm northern European and I understand the standards on animal welfare are different in different parts of the world but this was truly terrible.

Small and poor cages, animals in poor health and anything for a Euro. Wanna feed a giraffes some snacks, buy it at the desk. Wanna swim with some sea lions, no problems there a shows all day long. Everything is based around extra money by making the animals do stuff and they do not have the animals best interest in mind. Pony, camel rides in the hot sun all day long and so on.

This is not a place for people who care even a little about animal welfare.

titulo: Good day out especially for younger kids!
conteudo:
Went here with family recently and four grandkids under nine years old, they all really enjoyed it!
Although a little on the small side for a safari park it was still an enjoyable day.
The parking was a breeze and next door to the entrance.
Their was a good selection of animals and reptiles and everyone loved the parrot display.
It was all very chilled and relaxed and the final thing was the seals and the show at 5pm which again everyone enjoyed.
All in all it was a good valued , interesting and informative day out and not too bad on the foot leather as well!
As long as you don't expect too much you should have a decent day out and the lunchtime swimming pool which is free is a welcome bonus!

titulo: Always you'd for a trip to the zoo...
conteudo:
Really enjoyable day out.

They have improved some of the enclosures an added some lions - very impressive.

The overall feel is still of a small scale, budget operation but none the worse for that.

Worth a visit if you are in the area.

titulo: very enjoyable day with the family
conteudo: Today we went to the safari park with our son and family including 3 grandchildren and in laws. First went to the sealion show which was very good and some of the commentary was in English. We then went to the covered area to eat. The food was delicious and I thought all the staff worked very hard to provide a good service and welcoming atmosphere. The grandchildren were treated to swimming with the sealions which was very well organised and they loved the experience. We then spent a short stay at the pool area before visiting the animals in the zoo. A good selection of animals, loved the orangutan and the white lions were very grand. Although not a large safari park I think it is well laid out and a very pleasant relaxing time was spent by all walking around the zoo area. Lots of palm trees to provide shelter from the sun. Certainly recommend this attraction for a relaxed and interesting day out with the family. Only negative comment: the bathrooms could be serviced more frequently during the day especially the one near to the cafe and outside pool area.

Visited Rio Safari recently and had a really good day. All of the animals seem really well looked after and happy however there was one animal who seemed a bit distressed and I emailed Rio safari to express my concern about this animal. They responded the next day and reassured me that they were aware of the problem and that they were making changes to make the animal happier. The shows are entertaining and informative and my 11 month old son loved the zoom in show. There are some negative reviews about Rio on here but I would say go and see for yourself and if you are concerned then let them know because they seem genuinely concerned about all the animals and their welfare.

Very poor
2 adult and 2 kids ( 3 years old)
€86 total
When late in the day very few people there
no pool open ,no food left at 1730
seen two shows and when around on the train
Feelt very sorry for most of the ainamas
They looked in poor condition and very sad
Frist and last time I would go


.

titulo: A good day out for all the family
conteudo:
We enjoyed our day at the Rio Safari in Elche and our kids loved it.
You can take your own picnic and eat it in the shaded picnic area just outside the main entrance.
The shows are fantastic and the safari is very educational.
We took our swimming stuff and went swimming in the pool for half an hour to break the day up.
The really good thing about this attraction is that apart from food and drink everything we did was included. Although we did pay extra for pictures of the kids with parrots.
If you buy a bag of nuts you can feed most of the animals with them. You can swim with the sea lions but this has to be booked and paid for in advance.

This time my daughter was old enough to fully enjoy the trip and that's just what she did.

She's nearly 3 so we enjoyed her being allowed in for free. For a Saturday it wasent as busy as I thought but was great for my daughter. All the monkeys were out in force.

We saw the parrot show, went on the car ride around the zoo (which was amazing) and then the sea lion show (which is my favourite) all of which were great fun.
We even got to meet a sea lion and have a picture taken with him.

It's a great price for a day out and it's great for the family. Maybe next year she will be brave enough to go on the pony.

This places brings tears to my eyes as I see animals with no leaves, and no fresh running water. I saw a turkey just rotting a dying. The other animals looked sick. They are not educated on how to care properly for animals. They had rotten stale, contaminated water full of poop to drink from with NO SHADE just rotting in the sun.

The snack bar food was nasty. The speed cars were terrible and toxic.

Don't support this barbarianism.

We had a lovely day here on 31 May 2015. All of the animals appeared well fed and looked after. I had downloaded a discount voucher so got a 30% discount on entry price. Well worth looking on the website to see if they have any offers on. Both the Parrot show and the train ride were in both Spanish and English which was good, the only downside to this was on the safari we were sat in the back trailer and couldn't really hear what was being said, this was due to the speakers not being very loud and a group of Spaniards having their own very loud conversation. The sea lion show was only in Spanish but you can get the general idea of what is being said by the actions.
All in all a really enjoyable day.

we had a lovely day here on 13th May 2015.We packed a picnic and we stayed for over 6 hours . Can't believe some of the negative views . They are not deserved .yes we can all find something we feel is wrong but all I say is try yourself. We visited with our nearly 4 year old grandson who loved every minute . Down loaded a discount of 30% from website on to phone . The safari train takes you through and up close to the animals .well worth it. The shows were good especially the sea lions . No animal were over used and really enjoyed them selves . Overall it was good value .plenty to see . Plenty of picnic areas. Childrens play area . We all loved it. One point I would say is we all had open saddles on and the stones were uncomfortable we were forever shaking them from our saddles as we walked around next time would wear full shoes. Little price to pay for a great day out .

We visited Rio safari today 14/05/15. the animals were starving and very dirty! Some of them didn't even have water bearing in mind it was 42 degrees!! There were very few staff either! Didn't get to feed any of the animals at all today except the giraffe and that was only because myself my mum and two little girls picked him some grass!! I thought it was very expensive for what was there ( not much )! Has definitely gone down hill from when I last went!!! Also the goats there supposed to be fat iv seen more fat on a skelington very very disappointed!!! Will not be returning!!!!

We always visit here and have a thoroughly enjoyable time. Went on the free 'train' ride which gets you very close to the animals. Also saw the new and lovely white lions. Unfortunately could not feed carrots to the giraffe this time as its enclosure was being refurbished along with a couple of others - but that's really good news for the animals in question. Upgrades are always positive to see. The displays are excellent - the parrots, sea lions and also the birds of prey. And after almost 4 hours of viewing lovely cool beers and possibly the best bacon bocadillos ever!

titulo: Absolutely brilliant and worth the money to get in!!
conteudo:
Not quite the boat ride that it used to be, they have now replaced this with a safari truck ride, is probably the same length of time as the boat used to be.
But really good zoo, lots of animals and a wide variety and lots of hands in interaction with kids.
If you but the peanuts in the way in you can feed hear to the animals, pretty much all of them are allowed! Which is good as the animals 'ask' for the food and properly interact with you.
The shows are also quite good and there are ample opportunities to have photos taken with the animals, they do charge for these but the kids get to touch/hold them.

Absolutely brilliant hands on family fun!

Not quite as advertised, it's only a small whereas the adverts make it out be something bigger.
However the children enjoyed it which was the point of the visit. We took a packed lunch and drinks as we had prior info from friends who had been. I suggest you do the same as we checked prices in the eating areas and they are on the expensive side.

It was a fun visit and a good way to end an incredible holiday.
The wide variety of animals was great!
However I didn't like the fact that on arrival I was forced to pay 7 euros after a woman forced a SNAKE on to my neck and took a picture.
The ticket prices are very fair at a 22,50 euro each.
Defiantly worth a visit.
Thank you Elche

We had a lovely visit with 8 month old, 6 year old and an 8 year old. They all really enjoyed. One of my daughters even got called up to help with one of the shows with a parrot. She was delighted . Only thing it was a little expensive but thanks to some discount vouchers was a great help. Burgers were good but I would advice bring your own picnic. We were sorry we didn't. Words of advice.... wear insect repellent :-)

Went here before we had to fly home as we had to be out of our apartment at 10am and flight was at 9pm. It is quite easy to find, although we did have a sat nav.

The staff all speak English and take a photo of you when you arrive. It is a nice walk around the park and as we went in March it was easy to see the animals. Some of the animals, such as the jaguars and tigers, did not have big enough cages in my opinion, although the park was working on that and are currently building some new enclosures. Most of the animals looked healthy and looked well cared for.

The safari train was quite nice and took you into the enclosures of some animals. The sound didn't work when we went but there is normally information about the animals and conservation I believe.

We ate some dinner in the restaurant near the entrance and there are a wide range of snacks available here as well. I had a cheese toastie and found it was lovely. My husband had a burger and he said that was nice also.

Overall I had a nice time, although I thought the price was a bit expensive for the amount of animals there were to see.

We visited Rio safari with our daughter in March which is out of season. The safari was under going some works to improve the enclosures and overall park and there was limited staffing the place did look run down to. After mentioning all that we had a good time and we will return to see how the improvements have gone and during peak season to. I would advise getting hold of the discount voucher flyer available at bars and supermarkets. Like the header says worth a visit.

titulo: Nice place to spend a few hours with young children
conteudo:
The weather was lovely on the day we went and being in February the place was very quiet and had about 40 visitors whilst we were there.

We went to see the parrot show which the boys enjoyed and then we went on the small train to go round to see the animals which was great as previous reviewrs state, its a good way of seeing where the particular animals you want to see so that you can come off the train and make your way back to your favourite animals - which mine were the giraffe as one came right up close to you over the fence! :-)

We had seen everything we wanted to see in 2 hours and then we went over to the Go Karting section which was reasonably priced and so we spent another hour.

All in all, a lovely family day out and I would recommend anyone who have children to visit.

We took our 2.5 year old while on holiday. We were impressed it was open in March, out of season. There was lots of work going on to better the park but we had to walk through building sites to get around. The food and drink stalls around the attractions were only open one at a time, due to running on skeleton staff. We would definitely go back in season, think it's a little over priced at €22.50 each so look any for the discount flyers. It just needed a clean and tidy up and the farm animals at the back of the park just needed a little more attention, think it would be great in season with pony rides n animal holding etc. Enjoyed all the different exhibitions of animals and the variety. There was a little water park which think will be great with the weather.
Would recommend this to all.

Visited in Feb 2015 with my children. The animals are well looked after, albeit the parrots could do with more space. The Sea Lion show was very entertaining and the park is a good size for young children. We visited during a transition period so there was quite a lot of construction work going on, but the staff were very pleasant and welcoming. Having a 50% off voucher made this a very worthwhile experience.

We visit this safari park every year, we love it so much! The staff always greet everyone with a friendly welcome. As soon as you enter the park you get your photo taken with a large snake (not obligatory of course) or if you prefer just a family photo it's not a problem. You have the option of touring the whole safari park in a train pulled by a jeep (different sessions throughout the day) which gets you up close to the animals or if you prefer you can stroll round the park on the pathways laid out. We always do both as both ways are great fun. You have the opportunity to buy small bags of peanuts at the reception and cafe so you can feed the animals. Our best experience was feeding nuts to the gentle giraffe which went down a treat with our young grandchildren! There is also an opportunity (for a small fee of 5 euro) to get inside the ring tailed lemurs enclosure where you get to feed them pieces of fruit and get your photo taken with them. They have an excellent sea lion show and a parrot show at various times throughout the day - well worth seeing! You can bring a picnic or eat at one of the two restaurants or cafe and I can recommend both restaurants for good variety of food at reasonable prices. There is also a pool at the entrance of the park for any visitor wishing to use it for a small fee. At the far end of the park there is also a go-kart track suitable for kids and adults alike. My only disappointment this year is the fact that there was no elephant show which was there every year up until summer 2013. It was excellent and afterwards you had he chance to get a photo sitting on the elephants back. Also they used to have an area where you could feed kid goats with pieces of apple which you purchased for 2 euro - it has now gone, sadly, as it was a great hit with all who participated. One thing I highly recommend is to book a session with the sea lions. It is totally worth the experience for any age group. We did it this year and thoroughly enjoyed interacting with the sea lions, getting photos with them and even getting a kiss from one! Unbelievable! We all came away with huge smiles on our faces and vowed to do it again next year! This park is an absolute must for all ages and is a wonderful day out in the sun!

Á small place but that means you can cover the whole place within a day. The safari ride is a fun way of exploring the zoo and allows you to go into the animal areas. The sea lion show is very entertaining, don't miss it!

Visited in October, it was surprising. We first walked in after going through the entrance and was greeted by a employee with a snake in her hand! We hopped onto the safari jeep which drove us around the grounds. Lots of different animals. Some of the shows were funny. The giraffes were fantastic. Food to be honest was ok, would take a lunch from home next time! Staff are very warm and welcoming. The bird show was very odd as at the end they involve a Jack Russell dog!! This is quite a small place so do not expect too much but still a good day out.

We are now regular visitors and thoroughly enjoy our day here. Always something going on with the parrots, birds of prey and the sea lions showing how intelligent and clever they all are with their displays. The animals all look in fine condition and the staff clearly care about their welfare. It's a joy to see the inter action between the animals and the visitors, especially the children and it's just a lovely day out. BUT please do not feed peanuts to the parrots!

A lot of people seem to think that Rio Safari were a bit neglectful with there animals and that the staff are directed to get you to pose for charged photographs rather than look after the animals interest.
OK, so number one, this is a zoo, animals will always look a bit unhappy caged up, wouldn't you, I know I would. Secondly, this is a business, and so to look after the animals, a business has to make enough money to pay for it's overheads. So posing with the snake when you go in, or posing with the parrots or the bird of prey etc, is all part of their trying to make a better, more successful business, and of course up keeping a place so to make it a pleasing experience for the visitor. Now I sound like as if they are my mates, but no they are not, and I am not fond of dishing out too much money unnecessarily, but I don't like seeing people picking holes in something like a zoo. If you don't like seeing animals in captivity DON'T VISIT A ZOO, you are going to be really disappointed.
So now less of the rant, I was here with my 10 year daughter, she posed with Julia, the Boa Constrictor, and bought the packet of peanuts to feed the animals with, had a laugh at all the goats running around in circles and the chimpanzee eating it's fleas. Same stuff I used to do with my parents when I was a kid, and she really loved it.

titulo: One of our favourites whilst on holiday
conteudo:
Take the train to work put what's where. Then watch the shows they run so you can make it to the next.
You get a photo opportunity at each show.
Sealion was awesome.
We got 30% off voucher and felt it was a bargain
Take your swimming stuff as there's swimming opportunities.

We visited this park last week,all I can say is thank goodness we went on the safari train first instead of walking round in the intense heat,I didnt expect to see animals running around as way too hot but felt very sorry for the lions,from what I could see there was just a big square of dust,no grass,rocks or anything for them to interact with,just laying in what shade they could find,even when it cooled down I couldn't imagine them doing much,I know there is building going on for them but will it be any different from what they have now?The plus side was the swimming pool,we couldn't wait to get into it.

I read all the reviews before today's visit - good and bad - but was not really concerned about the bad reports. I am on the Costa Blanca with my Daughter and 3 year old granddaughter. This is our 3rd visit to the Rio Safari and, overall, we have had good experiences. Today was a quiet day in terms of visitors and so the seal and parrot shows lacked a bit of atmosphere but still entertaining. All the animals appear to be well looked after, the staff are polite and helpful and notices about animals are clear. Lunch facilities are plentiful and reasonably priced.

There was no elephant this year but the Lion enclosure is being re-vamped. The giraffe is still as knobbly as ever! We came away slightly earlier than we might have done due to the excessive heat - but you can't blame Rio Safari for that!

We managed to print out a discount voucher ahead of arriving which save us 30%. Check beforehand to see if there is a discount for you!

We went to this zoo with moderate expectations as knew it would be small compared to many other parks that we have visited over the years. However it was a lovely surprise. Plenty to see and do and it's a great idea to have a little swimming pool with slide on site for when the kids need to cool down in the afternoon. Highlight was the sea lion show. Low light was the alligator area where the conditions weren't ideal. Having said that, the alligators themselves looked pretty indifferent...

Worth the long drive to see healthy happy looking animals compared to the animal park in benidorm. Worth the money easily. Big park and plenty of space to see the animals not crowded round trying to look over peoples shoulders so ideal for smaller or younger children

titulo: Great Zoo, Easy to walk around and see the animals
conteudo:
We have been to this Zoo a few times over the last 10 years. This last visit was the best. Even though it was peak time there was so much space to the animal. We never had to wait for people to move away.
The Orangutang enclosure is excellent, as is the monkeys.
The giraffes actually lean down to you to be stroked.
The Pygmy hippo was fun to see and no one else was around in that part of the zoo.
If you do go, take your swim wear as there is also a swimming pool out front next to a restaurant. You have full use of that while visiting.

We did have a good day out. Swam and fed the sea lions and had a swim to cool off later in the day. Only thing, It wasn't as clean as I would expect and some staff could do with having better manners!

We had a day here about a week ago and all had a fantastic time!

Even though it was August it was not very busy so we had plenty of time to see the animals without others blocking your view.

The sealion show and the train tour is a must!

Now for the downsides....
There is some construction going on for new enclosures, which is a must as some enclosures are very worn and dated and the animals could do with better!

Overall worth a visit

We visited here on a hot August day and we're amazed by the variety of animals. The train ride 'safari style' through the park was brilliant with the animals often approaching to within a few feet if you. The lions, tigers, orangutans and giraffes in particular were amazing to see, but there were just too many to mention. Definitely worth a visit

Have visited Rio safari a couple of times over the years and have found it to be getting run down, it's not worth the high entry price needs a revamp badly, brought the kids swimming with the sea lions which was expensive but good

We recently visited Rio Safari and booked to swim with the sea lions. It is a nice experience however it is a bit costly. The experience lasts 30 minutes at a cost of 30 Euros per person, children are charged at the same rate as adults. There is one to one interaction with the sea lions but there can be up to 14 people in the pool at the one time which does restrict the time. There are 3 different time slots, 12noon, 4.15 and 5.30pm. The 5.30pm slot seemed to have the least amount of people which I would recommend. There are no lockers for your valuables so keep that in mind when you are booking. All in all I do think the name should be changed as you are NOT allowed to swim in the water with the sea lions but rather walk through the water slowly. Maybe Sea lion interaction would be more apt.

This place provided a change from the pool or the beach. Not a bad price if you have the leaflet which offers 30%off. (we got ours at the tourist office) it could do with a better map as we wandered around a bit. The included train ride round the park was good as was the included pool and slide where we cooled off before driving home. The shows were funny but you had to listen carefully as done mainly in Spanish with short English bursts intermingled.

titulo: stay away from the tube at the  pool
conteudo:
6/10
okayish
but the flume at the pool go up stairs about 40 foot high then get told by attendant to make sure kids sit down on tube ....turns out otherwise they may go to fast , tube also open air one ....hmmm not safe at all

Yeh it is very outdated and not sure it's worth a visit. Animals are cool, the swimming pool was pretty good, food was average, but the place itself seems very outdated. Not many places like it around that part of Spain so worth a trip, but don't get your hopes up!
I did really enjoy the train ride around the venue but the animals seemed in poor condition and I wonder exactly about the conditions they are kept in.
It really need a complete make over, a paint job and a better road leading into it. Not exactly what's described on the posters but as I said does pass a few hours. Not served very well by bus routes either and can be difficult to find unless you have it on the sat nav.

What a good day out. Very good value for money especially with the discount voucher. You can go in and out all day. Free swimming pool and rides. Ride on a camel. Take a trip round the zoo on the safari ride or walk (we did both). Lots of shows at different times of the day. The sea lion one is very good for young & old. As it was very hot lots of the animals were resting in the shade. Whole place is much improved since we were last there

Went for the 2nd time today. Yes it's hot so be prepared. Shows are excellent and you get the chance to have photos with the animals for a fee. New swim with the sea lions is excellent. Buy the peanuts to feed to most animals even giraffe and zebra. You can go into lemur cage to feed them and have photo for 5 euros. We sat on an elephant last time but he's not there this season. Bring swimsuits to cool off in pool after. Kids loved the slide. Also camel or donkey rides out the front

What an absolutely super place. Very well laid out with Aztec feel. Myself and my children were able to ride on a camel for only 5 Euros each. We did pay extra again to allow them to sim with sea lions. 30 Euros each but what an experience for them we are certainly glad we paid for this as the kids faces were priceless. You do get stung for the photos at the end of the day at 8 Euros each but you don't have to buy them but they are so good you cannot resist a momento. Yes we splurged out but to actually stroke a giraffe and we even fed it mouth to mouth was an amazing moment. To stroke it and be so up close was a treat. The orangutan looked sad all alone but I googled the life of an orangutan and they usually live alone and prefer to be solitary animals. His enclosure was super. The shows were informative and very entertaining. Feeding of the crocodiles was a bit rubbish but that was because they just lay there lazy beasts. The pool area and slide was great for cooling off and there were plenty of facilities to eat or have picnics . wash your hands and toilets etc. You can walk in and out to your car easily so a mpicnic we will certainly take next time we are on holiday here. Amazing day out which cost us a bit but worth it xx

Went here in August 2013 with 2 children 7 & 9 years. It was a boiling hot day and there was not a lot of shelter. Animals are not in abundance and place looks a bit dry for them.
Anyway there were some fun shows. Sea lion show was very entertaining as was the elephant and parrot one. The keepers English was not that good so it was difficult to follow the commentary.
Walking around the giraffe took some food from our hands ( don't know if this was allowed) but my daughter enjoyed it.
There were a few additional things to do such as feed the lemurs that jumped onto your lap and have photos taken with various animals. All this cost extra so take some extra euros! The whole day wad not too expensive and it was a bonus to use the small pool with slide at the end of the day for a cool down.
I would recommend this day out for children of a similar age to mine. Nothing much for teenagers.
Don't think it's the kind of place you would go to twice.
